This place has an awesome vibe, but get there early or risk not getting in.  The staff took care of us and overall food was reasonably priced.  We tried as many rolls as we could stuff in our faces.
author: Matt P.

description:
The neighborhood is lively, the ambiance at Elephant Sushi is amazing and perfect, the service is great, and so is the fish!

I would definitely recommend this to anyone in SF or anyone coming from out of town. Just be prepared for the long wait (because it's so good) :)
author: Bre S.

description:
I absolutely love this place! Although it might be slightly unconventional, the sushi is delicious and the sake bombs are cheap during happy hour. They hadn't been open long when we went the first time and there were still a few kinks to be worked out, but overall the food was fresh and the staff was so nice.

What a great addition to the neighborhood! Check it out!
author: Emily S.

description:
Recommendation:
Beasty Boys
Giants Roll
Flaming Seabass
Himalayan Trout

Order them!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I was really excited to enjoy sushi at this restaurant. I looked online for their business hours, and arrived an hour before closing.

Upon walking in, I was told they were closed. I was surprised, as the doors were open, the projected sign was rotating, and even the Sushi Chef was making rolls. Not only this, but all the tables were full, save 2. I asked how that could be, and the hostess showed no empathy, but blankly stated again that they had closed already.

I mentioned that the time online shows that they were scheduled to be open for another hr. Her exact words: "That time is not correct, we close when we want."

Forgive me. I will take my business elsewhere. I will make sure to tell my friends, and as I work in customer service in the city, my customers to refrain from visiting this establishment.
author: Kyle P.

description:
Wow!

I'd heard great things about this place so I was so excited to try it! I expected a way based on its popularity, the fact that it was a Saturday night, and Yelp reviews telling me as much. I was a party of 1 so this isn't a typical circumstance, but!

It was only about 30 minutes until they called me telling me there was a space at the bar for me. +1

The gal seating/calling people was so overwhelmed and I don't blame her, she was putting in 110% effort trying to talk to people in person and on the phone at the same time, and she was the only one doing her job. +1

The food was incredible. I did omakase + a few things off the menu and two beers. I enjoyed - no, savored - every bite. The fish was fresh, well-prepared, and beautifully presented. +1

The service was awesome. I can't believe how attentive the staff was and how quickly everything was served given how consistently busy this place is. They were kind, engaging, and prompt. +1

The prices are beyond reasonable. I had a number in mind for what I would reasonably expect to pay for the incredible food and wonderful service I got, and the actual bill was really surprising. +1

I don't have a single negative thing to say about Elephant Sushi. 6 stars!

I can't wait to go back! And with friends, so we can order much more food!
author: Julie P.

description:
In my opinion this place is overrated. Their reservation, wait system is a joke. You have to physically present yourself at the restaurant to put yourself on the wait list. Then you provide the hostess with your telephone number so she can call you when your table is ready. She then spends half the time stressfully answering the phone and calling people on the wait list rather than tending to guests who are physically present. Expect to wait at least an hour on most nights. I get it, this place is busy so you wait, but get it together. 

The food is quite good and they have pretty creative rolls and fun things to try. It is more expensive than a typical sushi place, as well as more americanized. I'd go back if a group of friends were going, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Michelle A.

description: I love the hip vibe and the fresh sushi at this little gem in my hood. I did the make your own sashimi bowl which is such a fun idea.  I had octopus, spicy tuna, avocado, and garlic chips in mine. Sooo good. I'll be back again and again. I wish they were open for dinner!
author: Mark S.

description:
I usually don't write reviews, but I have never, ever been treated worse by a hostess.

I walked in with my sister and put our name in for 3 people. She told us it would be an hour. We were really hungry but it was worth it to me since my sister was visiting from out of town. 

An hour later, she gave us a call and all 3 of us walked over. She saw us 3 and said she only had us down for 2. I was very polite about it and told her I understood how she could have made that mistake, given the fact that we walked in with 2 and it was very loud in there. I'm expecting an apology and a plan on how we would solve this. Instead, she very, very rudely and sarcastically said that I told her 2 people, and it was going to be ANOTHER HOUR for a table for 3. At this point, there are other customers waiting outside and staring at this ridiculous predicament. This woman couldn't have been more in the wrong, and also more unapologetic. I asked her again, can't you bump us to the front of the list? This was very clearly not my fault. We both said 3 people and my friend was right outside, there's no possible way we would have said 2. Very clear she saw us together and made the mistake. She shrugged her shoulders and said "Another hour".

We're literally staring at each-other in disbelief at this point. Couple next to us watching said "wow that's messed up"

Worst thing about this, I live on the corner of Hyde & Valencia, come here at least once a week and now I feel very uncomfortable at my favorite neighborhood sushi spot. Service has been spot on every time, this woman is giving the whole restaurant a bad name.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I was so impressed. The minute you walk in, you can smell the sweet fresh scent of fish. And it smells delicious and super fresh! We waited 2 hours for our table and it was worth every damn second. We ordered flaming seabass, salmon nigiri, beastie boys, this salmon and crispy garlic roll, yummy pockets, truffle hamachi. Between 3 girls, we paid $38 each which is totally not bad for how awesome everything was. 
The beastie boys is literally made by the hand of God. I feel like the chef just stands back and thus magical sushi just appears in a bright white light floating down from heaven. It's quail egg yolk, Uni and Ankimo. And it is fucking orgasmic! 
The salmon nigiri was so fresh it almost tasted sweet. The seabass roll was insane. Even when it was done, I just kept scraping the leftover sauce and rice from the foil. It was pathetic but worth it! 
The yummy pockets were made of fresh scallops that were tossed in spicy mayo dressing and roe and it nested on the best tasting inari (tofu and sweet vinegared rice) in the world. 
The truffle hamachi was just as beautiful. It had flakes of black truffle on top of the freshest hamachi in all of the land.
The last thing that came was the salmon roll and it was amaaaazing! The avocado, fresh salmon sashimi and the crispy garlic was just an explosion of awesomeness!

Overall, if I could afford to eat ONLY elephant sushi food I would. I basically don't need anything else in life but this.

The service was also very good, by the way! The pretty host was very accommodating and friendly.

I will definitely eat here again, and again, and again!
author: Angela A.

description:
We had a fantastic dinner at Elephant Sushi shortly after their grand opening.  Immediately after we sat at the bar, the very friendly sushi chef started us off with a complimentary tasting of their delicious seared hamachi with truffle oil. We then followed up with a tuna and heirloom tomato salad, hamachi and albacore nigiri, and a whiteout roll (hamachi and butterfish), and washed it all down with a couple $2 sake bombs. Strangely, nobody else was downing sake bombs, but I guess the Russian Hill crowd is a little too sedate for that.  Elephant Sushi is definitely a great addition to Russian Hill, and probably has the best sushi in the North Beach/Russian Hill area. Definitely will be back for more.

It was very crowded on Friday night, but they do take reservations. There was a line out the door, but we were seated promptly after arriving on time for our 8pm reservation.
author: Allen T.

description:
The wait will be long, but when you are finally served the sushi, it will be some of the best that you have ever had. 

The Flaming Seabass is a gimmick, but who cares when it tastes so good? 

The rest of the sushi is an explosion of flavor in your mouth!
author: David Y.

description:
This is the best sushi I have ever had, and I've lived in SF for nearly a decade and am no stranger to food, fish, sushi and deliciousness.

There's consistently a line outside the door, but people are happy to wait at the wine bar up the block. When your table is ready, they just call you and you slam your wine and skip on down for quite possibly a blow-your-head-off experience.

On the menu there's a flaming sea bass that's a must have. It comes (sitting down?) lit on fire (!!what!!) and sometimes breaks the bowl it is in (happens a lot apparently)... regardless the place is magic. Lots of truffle and garlic concoctions on the rolls as well. Love it and will be back tonight hopefully.

PS parking in Russian Hill is atrocious so heed warning if you're driving.
author: Natalia W.

description:
Came during their "soft opening." Very trendy environment. I love the atmosphere and the theme. 

 Torched Mackerel Tataki - This was yummy. Watch out when the waitstaff brings this dish and takes this dish away because liquids may leak onto you. 

Double hamachi roll - You can tell the fish is fresh and it's absolutely delicious but I don't think it's worth $17 for the size of the roll. 

Rainbow roll - probably my favorite roll of the night. Fresh fish and love that the roll was cut diagonally. 

The owner dropped by our table and offered us a complementary fish appetizer. It was good. Sorry I can't remember what it's called. 


I'll be back to see the full menu.
author: Jess W.

description:
The wait for 2 people on a Friday night seems to be about 45 minutes to an hour. Come prepared to wait for a long time, and be sure to answer your phone when it rings, or your seat will be given away in 5 minutes.

The food itself is good, and the main point of appeal is the quality and freshness of the ingredients. My personal favourite is the spicy tuna roll and the Beastie Boys. However, the rice is quite lacking, and the maguro sashimi is extremely overpriced, at $22 for 5 pieces.
author: Mayumi O.

description:
OMG. Hands down, best sushi in San Francisco and honestly one of the top sushi places in California. My dad is a huge huge sushi snob and even he agrees with this. The quality of the fish is amazing. Super fresh, tender, melt in your mouth like butta. But the problem is, Elephant Sushi's excellence is not a secret so if you aren't there at 5:30 to wait in line OR you haven't got a reservation for 6pm, you're going to have to wait. 

Service was very friendly and attentive but because the place is small and there are a lot of people that want to dine there, it's very quick. Which is a good thing, but if you are hoping for a long, intimate, romantic dinner where you can linger - this isn't it. This is where you come to get top notch fresh sushi/sashimi and be done in under an hour :) 

The blue fin bites are incredible, although very expensive for the portion. Actually, overall, the prices are definitely up there but in this case even a cheapo like me is okay with it, because you truly get what you pay for. Which is amazing quality fish.
author: Anna J.

description:
Don't get me wrong the food here is excellent, but the way they treat their customers is appalling. I've been turned away from here on multiple occasions as they are 150% UNaccomodating. 

I showed up right at 6pm on a Saturday night with 4 people, they had 4 bar seats unreserved and a table for two. They REFUSED to seat us when we asked for the 4 at the bar as they are only for "two couples who do not know each other". They told us they would only seat two at the bar and two at the table and we were NOT ALLOWED to speak to each other. We ended up going across the street and even the owners there said they have multiple complaints about their management. 

Another time I showed up with a group of 5, we called ahead (they never answer) we came RIGHT as they opened and they simply told us, "We don't seat parties over 4". 

I will never give this place my service ever again, I can not believe they are still in business with the way they treat their customers.
author: Kelly D.

description:
Alright - so I've been back three more times since the soft weekend launch and it's only gotten better. Not only is the service still great and friendly (including giving you an opportunity to give them feedback when you get the bill so they can improve), the menu has expanded with each visit, in great ways.  I've had a chance to try most everything on the menu, and here are my favorites:
1. Himalayan Trout appetizer
2. You can't go wrong with any of the nigiri either...the blue shrimp in particular is really tasty
3. Sashimi salad - ultra fresh, well balanced, lots of fish
4. Hamachi truffle appetizer
5. Lion King roll
6. Housemade complimentary ginger
author: John H.

description:
Best sushi in the city, hands down. You might have to wait, but I am more than happy to do it every single time. Everything is so fresh and the flavors will blow your mind-PLUS, $2 saki bombs all the time!!

Bests on the menu:
Hawaiian poke chips n' dip
Red Dragon roll
Godzilla Roll
Red and Yellow roll
Boombox roll (I know banana sushi sounds weird but it is fantastic)

I would skip the flaming sushi, it's great to show off for your out of town friends but it's not nearly as good as everything else they have to offer.
author: Lydia W.

description:
This place was amazing! Got here right before 6pm and there was already a line out the door of people waiting for walk-in tables. We got lucky and nabbed one.

We got to try a ton of rolls, including the White Out (my fave, BOMB.COM, we got 2), Yummy Pocket (really good), Himilayan Trout (outstanding, some might find it a little salty though), Giants Roll (can't remember this very well but I remember it being good), Beastie Boys (wanted to try it; was good but prob won't order again), Walu Carpaccio (very good, this was the free dish of the night), Ya Man Roll (very good), Alaskan (good, plain), and Double Albacore (excellent; the honey mustard randomly works)

The fish was just super fresh and the service was also outstanding. Highly, highly recommend.
author: Erica L.

description:
Man oh man do I love sushi, and seriously thank you Elephant Sushi for hookin' it up! Where do I start...ok first there is a wait to get in this place, your looking at 45 to an hour. I know! It blows. But luckily there are wine bars around this place, so put your name down, leave your number and hit up one of the nice little wine bars around. Want to go to a bar? Head to Polk 2 blocks away, make sure you walk up and down Green street if you do decide to go to Polk, Union has a nasty little hill there. *Side Note* Make sure you don't bring a party of friends, it's best to come with 2,3  at most 4 people or you'll be waiting forever.

Back to the restaurant- it delicious! The place is small, cute, a bit dark but definitely serves up some mean rolls. I went with two other friends, so we just ordered rolls and shared. It's the best way to go. Sake Bombs were $2. We ordered the the Chips and Dip, only 4 Wanton chips come on this dish with a spicy tuna poke and good mustard sauce to top it off. We also got the Flaming Seabass which is pretty much a hit at every table. They cook it up right in front of you for about ten mins and open it up with its ready for you to eat. It's nice and saucy. We also got the Double Albacore roll, it was great! Another saucy roll with fresh Albacore bites to leave you happy. You like fresh fish without a lot of sauce? The Whiteout roll is the thing for you! The butterfish which is thick and fresh and leaves you craving more. You can't go wrong with the Ya Man roll either, the salmon is amazing thick cut as well, simple and good! 

I wish we kept ordering. It gets a bit pricey but I must say, your in for a treat when you come here. None of this canned, imitation stuff here. We're talking about thick, fresh, meaty fish. Exactly what I'm looking for when I want and crave sushi. Sauces are always adored. I'm telling you, come here! If you don't enjoy it as much as I do, I don't know what to tell you. So enjoy!
author: Rachel T.

description:
dare i say it...BEST SUSHI EVER.

i can't say enough good things about this place. i absolutely loved the entire experience. yes, there's a wait...but put your name down, have a glass of wine elsewhere and come back. i'm not kidding when i say that the wait is worth it. we waited close to 90 minutes and once we had a bite of blue fin tuna all our worries were long gone.

you can't go wrong with the drink prices:
$2 sake bombs
$4 hello kitty saketini

things we ordered and loved:
hamachi truffle
hawaiian poke
spicy hamachi
giants roll
tuna pockets (blue fin tuna - the most amazing bite sized piece of goodness ever)
beastie boys
author: Mandy A.

description:
I FINALLY got around to trying Elephant Sushi and I am SO glad I did! This is some of the better sushi I've had in SF, bonus it's a very central location and is walking distance from a lot of neighborhoods, North Beach, Marina, etc. 

I went with one other person and we got three rolls which was more than enough, we were both so full. We got the Double Albacore, White Out Roll and Flaming Seabass; all three were delicious! The white out and flaming seabass were my personal favorites. The fish was very fresh and you got a lot of fish on each roll, they didn't skimp at all which is nice. The prices are also very reasonable for sushi and all the fresh fish you get on it. 

Heads up, they won't seat you until everyone in your party is there so try to arrive at the same time so people aren't awkwardly waiting. The restaurant itself is small but they do a good job of flipping tables over so there isn't too long of a wait. The servers and hostess were all extremely friendly and personable! I cannot wait to go back soon :)
author: Lizzy U.

description:
Awesome, I know this place has a ton of reviews. Just go there, you're going to love it.

Food was amazing, very fresh. Probably the best sushi I've ever had and I've had a ton.

Pros:
-Sit at the bar, very fun to watch these guys work. Super efficient.
-Flaming Sea Bass dish was the most interesting presentation of a dish I've ever had in a sushi restaurant.
- Amuse-bouche once you're seated is a nice touch

Cons:
- Pricey wine-list/glass - $14/$42 respectively
- Somewhat small restaurant, reservations are a good idea.
author: Chris A.

description: Definitely one of the TOP sushi spots in the city. The Beastie Boys were delicious and the Escolar rocks. Go soon, go now.
author: Blabla B.

description: The only reason I give them 4 is the long wait!! I wish they took reservations! It is a small place but they have the best sushi ever. Their menu options are so unique and they have special types of sushi
author: Sara K.

description:
We go to Elephant Sushi every Friday. That says it all! Great sashimi, maybe the best in the city.

We like the truffle hamachi, sashimi garden salad, flaming sea bass and whiteout the most. It's a little hike for us to get to the restaurant, but totally worth the effort.
author: X L.

description: This place gives San Francisco it's bad name. Literally THE most pretentious sushi restaurant in SF. Routinely stop "taking names" at 730-8 when there's no one waiting outside, empty tables, and the hostess is trying to reach people who put their name in but no one is coming back because they always quote a 2-3 hour wait. It's purely a sham to make you think they're impossible to get into. Sad too since I'll be honest and say the food is solid. Not as good as ebisu, but it's good. Still though, it's not worth one garbage experience after another when good sushi is a dime a dozen in SF. Elephant, you will get what's coming to you. One star.
author: Alex B.

description:
Get the flaming fish dish. If only for the entertainment factor.

Get the beastie boys (if you like uni and ankimo)

Get the happy pocket. You know what? Get two. You're welcome.

Get the salmon on the salt lick thing. 

This place is great value for great quality fish. It's a light fun atmosphere. I felt it was more personal than Ichi+Ni, and less formal than Maruya. Sort of the perfect middle, a la goldilocks. Will definitely be back. 

You can make reso's for 6pm at the bar, but you have to use your phone (remember that old thing?), no internet resos here.
author: Shanee B.

description:
Came here most recently with a couple friends who were visiting the city, and I was absolutely impressed once again. Creative dishes! And most importantly, the fish was fresh and delicious. 

Good parking is kinda tough to find. It's always busy, so it may be a wait to get seated, but the staff's always very accommodating. Service was excellent, they even gave us the Hamachi truffle appetizer on the house, which was quite delicious by the way. I ordered the White Out roll this time and fell in love. It's a small, dark restaurant and the atmosphere is overall modern and casual. Perfect place for a date or to even hang out with some friends visiting the city. Oh, and by the way, sake bombs are only $2 here. Definitely one of my favorite sushi spots in SF, and I always look forward to coming here.
author: Rowena J.

description:
My friends and I lucked out on finding this place. We were looking for a place to eat and found this place near us on yelp. It helped that they already had great reviews. I was blown away by the food and it has become my fave sushi restaurant. Hamachi truffle app is a killer. I loved the taste of the fish especially with the truffle and garlic chips. Flaming sea bass was amazeballs. It's a great roll with a sweet sauce. White out and Godzilla are my fave rolls. White out has the yummy butter fish and garlic flavor. Godzilla is a spicy tuna wrapped tempura roll. Love that chili sauce at the bottom of the dish that gives it a nice kick. 

If I lived in SF I'd be here all the time. Parking is a biatch and it's much easier to take a cab and get dropped off.
author: Johanne M.

description: Knew going in wait would be crazy- basically waited an hour. Seated at the bar which was pretty good for bar seating and had view right into kitchen.  Our server was so friendly and excellent and gave great recommendations- we trusted him and everything worked out.   Definitely want to come back!  Loved Himalayan Trout special.
author: Victoria H.

description: We were visiting from Newport Beach and we LOVE sushi but haven't found anything that compares to our favorite spot at home. This place was right up there with our local spot. Delicious sushi, urban setting, great service. This has made it on our "places to visit" when next in San Francisco.
author: Brandi G.

description:
This is a great Korean sushi joint with creative rolls that will wow your taste buds.  Normally I prefer Japanese sushi and traditional sushi and rolls, but this place is definitely worth a shot.  Chances are you haven't had anything is SF quite like this!

I did have one bad night here in service but that's probably because my waiter dropped a flaming roll plate temporarily setting the adjacent (to me) customer on fire.  Seriously, this happened.  Waiter went into melt down and disappeared.  Crazy shit.  

Other than that one hiccup in service this place is a great spot, great for a date, and deserves respect.
author: Kyle K.

description:
Have now been here 4 times and it keeps getting better (except perhaps that it's no longer BYO :( ).

Tom the chef is great and friendly, and the menu continues to evolve. Himalayan Trout? OMG! So god and huge pieces of fish with delicious basil oil. 

Also great were double albacore roll and Yummy pockets of Scallop on tofu. They just keep innovating.

Service continues to improve but cooed go further - having said that, we arrived at 9pm on a Friday when they were slammed...
author: Diarmuid R.

description: I can't decide which to comment on first: how amazing their sushi is or how kind we've been treated by their staff, who truly are the epitome of graciousness. Either way, Elephant Sushi is the best sushi joint in the city - - and that's not just their $2 sake bombs talking ;)
author: Bill B.

description: The bf found this place on yelp and I must say it was better than I had expected! The wait is a bit long... but I did enjoy my meal. Customer service was great. they have $2 sake bombs and a $5 Hello Kitty Martini haha i think it was all night not sure. The only thing I wasn't really a fan of was the Hawaiian Poke Salad :( I was thinking more along the lines of poke and no salad LOL so read carefully. WHAT I DIDN'T ORDER BUT SHOULD HAVE ORDERED WAS THE FLAMING SEABASS SUSHI. THE ENTIRE RESTAURANT I SWEAR ORDERED IT BUT FAILED TO GIVE US THE NOTICE -____- but it was pretty cool to see something on fire at every table. From the looks of it, it looked like they enjoyed it. We shared 3 rolls and it was pretty filling. I am a big eater.... so I was surprised at how filling it was. I will definitely be back... maybe soon because I LOVE SUSHI :))
author: Kristina L.

description: Great great sushi but honestly the seating and lack of reservations is TERRIBLE, 4 times now I have been turned away by the hostess saying they no longer take reservations at 8:30pm for a restaurant that closes @10 and is only open for 4 hours. This is horrible. Either open longer or take reservation. This is just poor!
author: Cory W.

description:
FOOD:
Giants roll so good my fave
Everyone got that flaming roll 
Real ginger 
Unfiltered sake so good
Spicy hamachi 
Spicy tuna


SERVICE:
Good


ATMOSPHERE:
Very cute and trendy, it's in the middle of my RussianNob neighborhood, so it's a cute location. 

1.5.14
author: Angela L.

description: This place serves the best sushi (the best I've ever had to date). I would recommend the White Out, Flaming Sea Bass, and Tuna Belly. Sit at the sushi bar to see the artists chefs in action.
author: Julie V.

description: I'll keep this short since so many peeps have written about this place. Definitely sit at the bar with your date if you like extra attention to details and samples!! Flaming sea bass is great for non-raw fish eaters and definitely get a reservation if you don't want to sit out waiting, but could be interesting for a first date. The wait staff are nice but like the New York vibe they don't want you sitting around reminiscing after your meal unless you keep the drinks flowing :)
author: John N.

description: Visiting from out of town and walked all the way from fishermans wharf and waited another hour but boy was it worth it.  The hamachi and trout sashimi starter were amazing.  The only thing that kept it from getting 5 stars was the beastie boys.  I think that one was a misstep for me.  The combination of sea urchin and raw qual egg didn't really do it for me.  Other than that the white out and the flaming sea bass were great.
author: Bo W.

description: Elephant Sushi is my favorite place for Sushi in the city. They don't take reservations and they are always busy - so prepare to wait. Order the 49ers roll and the flaming seabass and you won't regret it. I love sitting at the bar because Yoshi is the best!
author: Madie H.

description: Of all the places I've had sushi this is hands down the best place I've been to in the city! Make sure to make a reservation as it gets packed quickly. Can't wait to go back again soon!
author: Heather B.

description: The most creative high quality sushi in the Bay Area for the price.  I don't care to go into San Fran but when I do this will be my safe must go to spot.  Nothing more to add to other reviews.  Can't wait to go back.
author: kim s.

description:
My last day in SF, I decided to try this place out because of its great reviews. I got there very early and found parking right out front, so I decided to take a little walk before they opened. When I got back at 5:45
I was now 4th in line . The door is opened at 6 pm and by 6:08 every seat was filled and there was a line out front. The place easily lived up to my expectations and I have to say The Flaming seabass was excellent, as a matter of fact everything I ordered was fabulous . I will definitely revisit this place next time I'm in SF.
author: Don G.

description: So disappointed in Elephant Sushi. We had 3 people in our party. Someone told us to go there after 5 to put our name on the list. That didn't work which was fine. Totally understand. So we went to a nearby wine bar and waited for them to open at 6. Went there at 5:50 and there was a line already. Waited in the rain. Finally got to the door and there were several tables open, but the hostess said she couldn't put the tables together. Excuses me? We are patrons. We waited in line? First come first serve?
author: Carol D.

description: Sushi was good. I expected better (fewer mayo-infused options and other cheap thrills) for the headache of a wait list / "answer your phone or you will go hungry" mantra.  Glad to have checked it out but there are much better spots in the city.
author: Laura R.

description:
Oh my god, this is the best sushi I've ever had. White out and spicy hamachi rolls were the best! In fact, we were so hungry and everything looked so good that we didn't even have time to take pics of our food. 

Pros: small (meaning it's quaint and cute), fast service, AMAZINGLY FRESH, inventive, friendly...amazing. Just simply amazing. And incredibly inexpensive. Two of us, with two rolls, a house special, and a carafe of warm sake...less than $50.

Cons: small (meaning there aren't a lot of tables), only take reservations to 6:00 p.m. on Friday and Saturday, long waits (we got there by 7:30 and only waited about 15 minutes, but others were waiting a long time). 

Just a fun place to visit and eat. I'd recommend to anyone. Especially the spicy hamachi roll.
author: Robert P.

description: Two starts for a humiliating waiting system. Poorly executed explanation of how their waiting list works. Rude front door staff. There is a list- not anywhere shown, that you have to get on at 6pm and no later than 8:45 pm (place closes at 9:30). Where and how is this explained besides the rude girl at the door?
author: Yelena B.

description:
Typically speaking, when a sushi restaurant gives their rolls creative names like the "White-Out Roll" or the "Flaming Seabass," you can be sure that the quality of the fish takes a back seat to whatever random flavor combinations the kitchen can throw together.

Not so at Elephant Sushi, which somehow manages to be the best of both worlds. The rolls we ordered (previously-named included) were all amazing in both flavor and quality. The sushi was so fresh that new fish was literally being carried in on ice during our meal! This was one of the most pleasantly surprising meals I've had in a long while, and I would return here in a heartbeat.
author: Aaron J.

description: Elephant Sushi is the best. They fish is super high quality, the menu is creative and fresh. Everything is great. They accommodate my gluten free needs beautifully. There is a ton of things on the menu that only have to be changes slightly or not at all to be gluten free and delicious. They also have GF soy sauce. This is one of our favorite spots on Russian Hill. Pro tip: come an hour early put your name on the list and go have a glass of wine at one of the many wine bars within 60 seconds of the door.
author: Amanda H.

description: It was some of the best sushi I've ever had, and although the wait on a Sunday night was 30 minutes they at least call you so you don't have to remain waiting outside. But what I want to know is WHERE IS THE MISO SOUP? Doesn't that violate some international law?
author: Brandon H.

description:
Oh man this place is so good.  Fresh fish,  creative combinations, and 2 dollar sake bombs!  It's really busy so it's important to call ahead and get a reservation - otherwise it's at least hour wait on a normal night.

The fish is so fresh here,  I've been to sushi places where you have to douse your sushi in soy and wasabi just to get it down - not good sushi!!!  Elephant sushi has perfect combination of flavors that just explode in your mouth and leave your taste buds wanting more.  Long story short - foods the bomb.  Himalayan trout, walu capprachio, basil salmon (off the hook), ya man roll,  and pretty much everything else on the menu is the bomb.

Service is awesome - Nesa at the front is so nice and so accommodating she's awesome. Sit at the front and the sushi chefs will give you tastings.  MAKE SURE TO BUY THEM DRINKS - they will drink with you.  

Price point is great for the quality of food.  Highly recommended!

Can't wait to go back!
author: Kyle A.

description:
Omg one of the best sushi restaurants.
Melt in your mouth sushi and creative. Try the hamachi truffle and the white out roll.
Amazing!!

I'd skip the flaming sea bass roll, nothing special except for the theatrics of sushi on fire.
author: katherine M.

description: I used to really like this place when it first opened. They had good quality fish and the sushi was well made and professional. The service was good and you always sat down with some seared escolar in ponzu sauce and truffle oil compliments of the house. Now the service sucks, the quality of the fish is dubious and most of all, the sushi is terribly made!  A huge ball of rice with minimal amounts of the fish. And, sitting at the bar, those preparing the food had majorly dubious sanitation standards. Made me lose my appetite. Throwing pieces of fish on the ground, at each other, throwing raw egg white on the ground, wiping their noses with the back of their hand or the smock they were wearing. So gross. Never coming back. Such a shame.
author: Grace H.

description:
I'm really big on quality over quantity when I eat sushi, because of my fear of tapeworms and other parasites that often result after eating too much raw fish.


WITH THAT SAID, Elephant Sushi is exquisite. It's dimly lit and totally romantic! Their ginger is homemade, though I'm not the biggest ginger fan, that is still impressive. You have to admire their quality. If fish smells fishy, then there is definitely something fishy about the freshness! (see what I did there?) My sushi melt in my mouth, and I think I ordered another roll after being full because it was so good. I do believe we waited around 30 minutes to be sat, but totally worth the wait. You will not regret it!
author: Adrienne V.

description:
This place was an outstanding find, and not as expensive as I'd expect from such an innovative sushi place. We got the beastie boys (with uni and quail egg), flaming sea bass (I'm a sucker for pyrotechnics), the white out, and finally the salmon avocado. The beastie boys was one bite of deliciousness (a must if you don't mind uni), and the sea bass roll was a show-stopper. The white out was delicious as well. The salmon avocado was the most boring of the rolls we ordered, but it's the first time in a long time that the salmon actually took center stage in the roll- it was very fresh and the taste balanced well with the avocado. 

There was a bit of a wait when we got there so we eventually opted for the communal table, but this was great because we could scope out what others were ordering before making our decision.
author: Ivana J.

description:
I met up with a few friends from out of town for a reservation at 7. After about 15 minutes of waiting for our server (a little long for my taste), we finally ordered a bottle of wine and a few plates to share (the flaming sea bass was yummy!). We were going for tapas-style that night and ordering about 2-3 plates at a time. All was great until we were forced out by the waitress because they "had another reservation at 8:30." They failed to tell us that before we sat down. To make it more awkward, the other party was just standing in the middle of the restaurant staring at us and waiting to be seated. And after all that, they refused to take more than two credit cards. C'mon, it's 2013.

I was looking forward to a longer dinner with friends I hadn't seen a while. If we weren't rushed, we probably would have ordered more food and another bottle of wine and given a better tip. 

So, bottom line: good sushi, not so good service.
author: Mel C.

description:
Items I like:
Salmon (Sake) Sashimi
Truffle Hamachi
Flaming Seabass

My all time favorite is the sashimi on rock-salt slab... it's so fresh, tasty, and delicious!! The salt slab adds such an amazing flavor that you don't even need soy sauce and wasabi. 

Small venue with mostly small tables. I'd suggest coming here with 2-4 people max.
author: CL S.

description:
Amazing sushi. We had the Ya Man roll, flaming seabass, and spicy tuna rolls. The salmon from the Ya Man just melts in your mouth. We tried a sample of the butter fish, which was also amazing. 
My favorite though was the flaming seabass that flames at your table while it cooks. The sauce and flavor were so good. Service was good. Be prepared to wait in line, as this place is very popular. Great food, will go again!
author: Lindsay C.

description:
A friend of ours brought us here because she said the sushi was to die for.  We've all heard that before... someone wants to bring you somewhere because they're convinced it's the best place on earth and you just have to try it.  So you smile nicely, choke down a mediocre meal and make a mental note never to trust said friend again.

But fear not... for Elephant Sushi is truly one of those out-of-this-world experiences you will never forget.  The food isn't to-die-for good... it's to KILL for good!!!!

Plate after plate of exquisite flavors... combinations of sauces and garnish and succulently tender fish that brought tears to my eyes and made me wish I could eat this food every night for the rest of my life!!!  The Mongolian-Japanese fusion was a never-ending delight.

Make a reservation.  Bring someone you love.

Repeat.

You won't regret it!!!
author: John S.

description: Horrible wait! Person at door said 1 hour for 3 people and when we returned told us at least another 20 minutes. Barely takes time to speak with you about waiting times. Will take 2 people waiting 30 minutes instead of putting 2 tables together for 3 people waiting over an hour. They need a lesson in customer relations badly. Do not eat here!
author: Howard F.

description:
Unique traditional but with a touch of western fusion style sushi.
Fresh ingredients, unique presentation, and all round wonderful place. Sushi bar staff is friendly, food is delicious.
My favorite sushi place in SF.
author: C Y.

description:
Best sushi rolls I've had in SF so far. It's along the lines of crazy combinations and flamboyant presentation but boy was it delcious! We showed up right before 6 and were surprised they weren't already open. There was a small line to get in but immediately after we sat the server came to our table with an amuse bouche - butterfish that was yummy! 

We asked what the most popular rolls on the menu are, and we were recommend to try the Flaming Seabass and the Red and Yellow. The flaming seabass did not disappoint! It comes to your table engulfed in flames and you have to wait about 10 minutes for the flames to go away. In the meantime, we enjoyed our Red and Yellow roll - Tuna and Mango. That was very fresh and delicious. Finally it was time to dig into the Flaming Seabass - oh my goodness. I'm not the biggest fan of creamy sauces on sushi but this was perfection in every bite. The rolls were not rice dense, meaning we had room for a THIRD roll. We ordered the Ya Man - a fresh salmon roll. I don't know what the sauce on that was but the roll was so refreshing and light, it was perfect after the Flaming Seabass.

All and all it was about $40 a person with a glass of wine each. Worth every penny, will be going back!
author: Aneilia M.

description:
We have had a lot of sushi, and are always on the hunt to find better and fresher places. Elephant sushi is hands down our favorite sushi place in CA! 

Very fresh, thick slices. The fish to rice ratio is impeccable and allows the fish to maintain its taste.

The flaming sea bass and white out roll were great.

We mainly get nigiri and we loved the yellow tail and blue fin tuna. The basil salmon is amazing as well. 

The uni is very fresh but I personally have had better in SD. Nonetheless, will always return to this place. Very well priced too. We ended up having to only wait 10 minutes even though we had no reservations. The owner Nissa is a sweetheart and very accommodating!
author: Shireen J.

description: This place was okay. They give house pickled ginger instead of the regular ginger that other places serve and it's terrible. The spicy tuna and the white out roll were the best. The fish was fresh and the service was nice. It was slightly hotter than usual in this restaurant but we didn't mind since the wait was really short. We also ordered the bestie boy which was monkfish liver served with uni and a quail egg. Overall a good experience I would come back a second time.
author: Samanyha O.

description: Went here for dinner with hubby to celebrate an anniversary.   Very nice ambience for a casual date night.  Food wise, pretty good.  Probably one of the best Rainbow roles I have ever had.  We had an assortment of things but all very fresh and well presented.  Service was pretty good - could have been better but excellent all around.  Would definitely return here.
author: Pemberly s.

description:
This neighborhood has sushi joints ... but not like this one.  

Ambience - clean sleek decor accompanied by house music when it starts to get dark.  Not even a huge fan of house or electro or whatever it's called, but it works.  They also project their logo onto the side apartment next door. 

Food - BOMB.  Truffle hamachi, torched mackerel, white out roll (hamachi and butterfish), naked roll (scallop and something else wonderful), and the sashimi salad (includes seasonal veggies like thinly sliced raw okra) are my favorites so far.  The hand pickled radish and the house soy sauce (hint of citrus added I think)  all taste great.  

Service - When I went during opening weekend, I thought it could use some improvement.  I went a week or two after and saw it improve dramatically.  The servers are attentive, friendly and helpful.  

It's obvious the owners have put a lot of work into this place.  While this place is a little pricier than some other sushi restaurants, it's completely worth it!
author: Dina H.

description: Best sushi restaurant I've ever been to. I've been twice with dates and would recommend it to anyone. The decor is darker bit the ambiance is friendly, well-lit and romantic. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. The sushi itself is fresh, fun and tasty.
author: Jason K.

description: Best sushi I've had in San Francisco. So fresh. Generous portions. Very high quality fish. I am very picky when it comes to sushi and this place was recommended by a friend who lived here for many years. It's so good. And the service was great, too. Highly recommended!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Check out the white out roll! Blows my mind... Best in the city. Wish they had miso soup but that roll makes up for it!!


A
author: Angela U.

description: Elephant Sushi is a trendy spot in Russian Hill that specializes in sushi. Although not the most authentic Japanese cuisine, Elephant Sushi is one of my favorite places to come for rolls. They've gotten creative with their menu, while still letting the fish shine through. My boyfriend and I had the omekaze sashimi, which was a sampler plate of different slices of raw fish. Without the rice, it was a great way to really get a taste for the quality of their fish. Each piece was slightly different, and I loved how some were already paired with lemon zest and wasabi bits so you know exactly what flavors they want to blend. The Flaming Seabass is a popular roll, as it's baked at your table with a hot blue flame. Although I typically stay away from Americanized rolls that are dripping with mayo or stuffed with cream cheese, the Flaming Seabass was not this at all. The table bake gave the entire roll a smoky flavor that was delicious when paired with the freshness of the fish. It's definitely a saucier roll, but definitely something fun to try. Their more standard rolls like the spicy tuna and the salmon avocado are also really good, particularly with the perfect sushi rice. Elephant Sushi is a popular spot very much on the radar of San Francisco residents, so be prepared for a wait!
author: Ashley T.

description: Love this place. Amazing sushi. Great service.
author: t k.

description:
So I would give the sushi 4 stars and the service 2 stars and the hostess 5 stars.

It's a small restaurant and there was always a wait at the door. We went to the wine bar up the street while we waited (yelp review to come) which was crazy expensive, but that's besides the point. 

Sushi here is pretty expensive but it is indeed very fresh.

I got the red dragon roll which is a shrimp tempura roll with spicy tuna. Not much in the roll and $12. Don't get me wrong, this was my favorite roll I tried and the fish was unbelievably fresh but it's still a tad pricey in my book.

I also ordered the spicy hamachi roll. I didn't like this one as much, it was too limey for me. Also this is a smaller roll ($9) so there are only 5 pieces. 

Our waitress was pretty rude and probably said one word to us the whole meal. She also took my beer from me before I got to drink the whole thing. When it came time to pay, the 3 of us put in our cards and the waitress came over to tell us it was a 2 card minimum and walked away for another 5 minutes (all we need to do is take one card out...why did you leave for so long?).

The hostess was awesome though. She was super nice and didn't get stressed out over all the people crowding around her. Maybe you guys should promote her to be a server because she was fun and upbeat and organized!
author: Jordan S.

description:
Went last nite..delicious fresh sushi,  nice atmosphere,  good service.. BUT I have been to tons  of restaurants and have NEVER been asked to leave.  I went with my 18 year old nephew and a young friend from out of town and I was so pleased to find this new yummy place with super fresh  sushi (I loved the flaming hamachi (?) so cool ) 
The atmosphere was great and I was thrilled to show off a new to me sushi place to my young friend from North Carolina and was enjoying our after dinner conversation until  I noticed a male server glaring nastily at me and then we were rudely asked to leave!!!
My friend from the south said this would never happen there and I told him it had NEVER HAPPENED TO ME EVER IN ALL THE YEARS I'VE GONE TO RESTAURANTS IN SF WE HAVE NEVEE BEEN ASKED TO LEAVE BECAUSE PEOPLE WERE WAITING. 
I won't be going back.
author: Lara S.

description: I'm writing this review because I really want to eat here and have heard good things but I still haven't been able to go because the wait is always hours long and you can't make reservations :/
author: Hannah W.

description:
Loved the assorted sashimi and the beastie boys (uni & other stuff). Fish was very fresh and delicious!  
Tried a couple rolls, but I think they use too much sauce for the rolls.
author: Robyn F.

description: It's really good, and on the fancy/creative side of the sushi spectrum (as opposed to a place that just serves up simple and delicious).  You can pretty much go all over the menu and enjoy whatever you're in the mood for.  This isn't a fancy place, and it's not too expensive (probably even considered cheap for sushi), but it's good.  Not a date place, really, just a solid 'lunch/let's get sushi' place.
author: Drew T.

description: I had really high expectations after reading the rave reviews that were posted here.  Truthfully, I wasn't that impressed.  It wasn't bad.  But wasn't fantastic either.  Several of the reviews recommended the flaming sea bass and the truffle hamachi.  Both were really disappointing!  The truffle oil over powered the taste of the hamachi, and the sea bass was too over cooked.  Presentation was beautiful.  Sake was decent.  The wait was over an hour.
author: Regina T.

description:
Canadian Salmon Nigiri was delicious! Great place, one of the best sushi I've ever had :) although you need to wait outside for a table so bring a jacket 
$$$ its a bit pricey but worthy it
author: Rocío A.

description:
Ordered 16 piece omakase for 2 people... 4 pieces of salmon, 4 pieces of tuna, 4 pieces of something completely forgettable, and 4 pieces of sea bass (which we had already ordered in 2 other preparations!). It's basically like they don't care and omakase means "boring stuff served in a boring presentation".  

If it hadn't been for all the hype I might have given them 3 stars... But there is really nothing special about the food here aside from a couple of interesting sounding preparations that didn't really meet expectations. The beastie boys sounded really great, but all those delicate ingredients were just fighting with each other and all got lost. The Flaming sea bass was fun to look at but the taste left much to be desired.

We had one other thing with capers that my wife liked, but I thought it was too oily. 

1 star for the fun presentation of the Flaming Sea Bass.
author: dan b.

description: Excellent, modern sushi at reasonable prices is the condensed version of a meal at Elephant Sushi. The fish was extremely fresh, and the highlight of each dish. The menu is unique and eclectic. I highly recommend the o-toro sashimi and flaming sea bass roll. The restaurant is small, and they only accept reservations for the first seating at 6 pm.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Amazing sushi!
Friendly/hip atmosphere.
Recommend sitting at the bar and watching the chefs prepare the sushi.
author: Valerie P.

description: For the value, this place is spot on. Wow, really great sushi that won't break the bank. I have tried a number of different sushi restaurants, but this place, while their selection is small, has great options. I had the omakaze, which consisted of 16 pieces of sahsimi for $35. This was perfect for me, because I wanted sashimi omakaze, but I didn't want to break the bank. Of course this was not the traditional omakaze, but it worked for what I was looking for. My girlfriend had the Hamachi Truffle and one other dish. I snacked a little on her portions and they were delicious. To be honest, I like this place, because it is nearby and is a great value. I wouldn't necessarily put quality of fish at the same level as some of the top notch sushi restaurants in the city, but when you need a sushi fix, this is a good option.
author: Alex L.

description:
The ambiance is so fun and cozy here. It's a great date or casual sushi spot. Most of the tables are for 2. If I lived in the neighorhood, I'd definitely be inclined to come back. But given that I'd stopped by based on reviews, when I happened to be in the neighborhood, I'm unlikely to return.

We tried the Ya Man Roll, the Spicy Hamachi Roll, and the White Out Roll. They were all okay. The Spicy Hamachi Roll was our favorite of the 3. The fish is fresh enough but the rolls were not that interesting. And despite other reviews warning of long lines, we had no wait - at 6:30 on a Thursday night. 

I feel very fortunate that San Francisco has so many choices for excellent sushi!
author: Susan W.

description:
I live a block from this place so I have been there several times. I think the Sushi is excellent, but be aware that this place is SMALL. If you have a bunch of friends and want to go Sake bombing DON'T go here. I would recommend for 2 people, and if really needed 4 but the space is small so keep that in mind.

I have introduced 3 different people to nigiri/sashimi here. My friends would always be worried, but I would order the Walu (butterfish) and they all loved it. The rolls are good, and they have a good selection of beer and sake, which I would stick with. This place is about the food, not really drinking.

All in all, great date spot, great sushi spot, and excellent. I would recommend to anyone.
author: Jared G.

description:
This definitely is a 'trendy' sushi joint. Their rolls were pretty interesting; the Boombox has bananas for example, but I wasn't really wowed by anything. Coming from Seattle may have tainted me with its great quality and affordability.

We sat at the bar and asked for the omakase, but their only omakase is a sashimi platter. No traditional omakase where the chef just continues to make you sushi until you are full.

Definitely a trendy spot to go on a date with, and a good place if you like different types of rolls and more fusion. Oh and they don't really serve elephant, not sure what the name means...
author: Josh P.

description: Excited to eat here, we arrived at 6PM, joined the line and yes, made it to the front! "Table for 4 please". They refused to put together two tables of two to make a table for four. What?! There were many tables for two and we waited in line, and you won't put two together for us? "Sorry we don't do that". To be clear the tables for two were not reserved. My husband asked how many tables for four they had, and they said only two. Don't go here. We were lucky to find Okoze near by. Which had amazing sushi AND it was funny when we looked down at our table for four to find it was two tables of two put together.
author: Hanna A.

description: Good, not great. We had several different rolls but, I want to come back and try the Flaming Sea Bass. The process looks fun as it cooks right in front of you. The Godzilla roll was great too. Very different.
author: Mark G.

description: Nice ambience, best sushi, great service, fresh fish! Three of us came Sunday night around 8. Definitely worth every minutes of waiting.
author: Stacy U.

description:
So my friend had been RAVING about this Elephant sushi place for quite some time. I could've tried it earlier, buuuut I had a full list of other places that sounded more appealing. Anyway, I was finally dragged here and I fell in love the moment I stepped into the door. The atmosphere was very adorable, yet modern at the same time. It had this comfortable, san franciscan feel to it.

Sake Bombs were a mere $2 = dangerous. Not a fan of beer, but I like the challenge of sake bombs. I forgot how much I hated beer after having a few. 

The food is great; quality of fish is really high and rolls are delicious and creative. If you're trying to impress a hot date, order the flaming seabass. They light it up and serve it to your table flaming hot (literally).

Service was splendid. I'll be back for sure.

TIPS:
- Always a wait as the restaurant is tiny. There isn't a wait area, so bring a jacket on a cold day because you'll be waiting outdoors.
- Parking in this area is horrendous; plan on arriving early and circling around a few times.
author: Maria N.

description:
Never forget.

This Paul Van Dyk song: www.youtube.com/watch?v=w9iiw1-GdvM

This roll: Boombox with scallops, avocado and brilliant slices of banana. Accented by a soy glaze. Topped with crunchy garlic chips. It's dinner. It's dessert. It's delicious.

Red & Yellow roll was a close second. Scallops and tuna come together under slices of mango and a sweet soy glaze. It's a tasty seafood fruit combo.

Much less impressive was the scallops appetizer. Surrounded by untouched chunks of mango unfortunately soaking in excessive sesame oil.

Compared to our first sushi stop of the night (http://www.yelp.com/biz/naked-fish-san-francisco#hrid:OmDOoEuNX0ZJfgQfVyXjfw) prices were much higher. $42 before tip. Not bad. Just not as noteworthy.

Host was a sweetheart yet our server didn't offer much personality. Space is small with the minimal modern look that never fails to impress.

They say elephants never forget. Won't be forgetting either roll anytime soon. Everything else keeps this Elephant at three stars.
author: Jason B.

description: I have been coming here for years and I love this place. The sushi is spot on and the lines are out the door and worth the wait. HOWEVER, don't believe their estimates for wait times. The unfriendly staff has left us waiting several times again and again beware of the wait list here!!!!
author: Caitlin C.

description: My absolute favorite sushi place in SF! The Flaming Sea Bass is amazing. Prices are fairly reasonable for the quality of food and great atmosphere. My only complaint is that they don't accept reservations. On any given night you can wait upwards of an hour+ but there are a few cute wine bars in the area to grab a drink while you wait.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Simply the best!

The line is well worth the wait. The sushi is incredibly fresh and just melts in your mouth! For a real out of this world experience, be sure to try the butter fish starter (the truffle is the best thing I've ever had). Other faves: White Out Roll, Seabass roll (comes in flames!) and the Hello Kitty Martini.

This is hands down my new favorite sushi place.

One thing to note: the place is pretty small, so probably a better place to bring a date and not an entire group of friends.
author: D K.

description:
Came here for a celebratory dinner with the husband - had read about it on Yelp. This place exceeded all expectations. The menu is non-traditional in that they make twists to sushi place staples such as tuna rolls. The fish is phenomenally fresh and the pieces of generous. 

Recommend trying the yellowtail bites and the Giants roll. Unique flavors that I can't stop thinking about!  

The banana ice cream is a wonderful, tasy ending to the meal! 

The only reason this doesn't get all 5 stars is because it's difficult to get in, even with a reservation. And although the prices are to be expected, the bill still hurt a little.
author: Convict T.

description:
My friend and I stopped by Elephant late last Friday evening and ended up waiting about 20 minutes or so for seating...not too bad.

The place is small and very cute, good for a date, saw lots of couples there.
We sat at the sushi bar and were immediately given a complimentary app Hamachi Truffle (2 sashimi pieces of yellowtail deliciously decorated). 

I would definitely recommend the Double Albacore Roll, it's an Albacore explosion in your mouth! 

Though it's quite the phenom, I would not recommend the Flaming Sea Bass roll. It was interesting to experience but we left pieces on the plate because we weren't that into it.

Will be going back to check out the rest of the rolls, etc.
author: Rachel R.

description: It was pretty decent.  Definitely a step up from most other sushi places in town.  Pricing is a little high but you do get quality fish.  I'm okay with that.  As long as I'm not being extorted for week old fish and soggy rice, I'm okay.  Where else can you go in this city anyways.  Sushi selection sucks around here.
author: Koalie W.

description:
Favorite sushi restaurant in the city!

The food is delicious, fresh, comes out quickly, and is reasonably priced. The staff is friendly and the overall atmosphere is nice.

CON: This has nothing to do with the restaurant, but just keep in mind that parking is pretty scarce in Russian Hill.
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
Seeing the praises given to this place SF is clearly confused about sushi. Good sushi isn't dragon roll, or rainbowpuppykitten roll, it should be about the rice, the right size, the fish, the knife work. The chef was clueless about his fish other than recommending us to order their famous hamachi truffle dish.

Truffle hamachi? No comment. A drop of truffle oil would make rotten food in your refrigerator taste heavenly.
author: C J.

description:
Elephant sushi has some great quality sushi and some very interesting rolls... absolutely worth stopping in! 

We tried a bunch of different rolls... some better than others. I am not a salmon person, but the salmon sashimi was outstanding! I tried the white out roll... based on other yelp reviews and recommendations... while the truffle oil oddly worked, it was way to rich to have more than 2 or 3 pieces. I would recommend trying this if you come with a larger group (for 2 people it was a little overwhelming). The flaming sea bass roll was also great! The one thing we ordered that I would highly recommend against (in all fairness, our waitress also told us it wasnt her favorite) is the monkfish liver. We figured we would try something new... it did not pay off. OH! also... they give each table home-made pickled ginger in a mason jar (this could not  have made me any happier!) it was delicious! 

Also, the staff was wonderful. Very friendly and on top of things. I would definitely come back here. Make a reservation if you can as we had to wait about 20 minutes, worth the wait though!
author: Jess K.

description:
Great place, the special rolls are the way to go, American Dream Roll! I'm going back for more! 
As people say it can get loud, but they are full and turning over a lot of food which is important with sushi. (never eat in an empty sushi joint)
author: Frank H.

description: Sushi was awesome... We had the Red & Yellow and Flaming Seabass (definitely recommend it)
author: Sean R.

description: I've only been here once but I keep wanting to go back. Its on the corner of a quaint block in Russian Hill and very small so I can imagine the wait getting pretty long. But this place is worth it. The menu is filled with unique plates and sake bombs are like 2 bucks. We ordered a bunch of small plates and it was all super interesting and yummy. I wish we ordered the flaming sea bass- everyone around us seemed to get it but us and it looked/ smelled amazing.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
I am beyond picky about sushi. If it has any sort of fishy flavor or is stringy tough to chew, I'm done. I can't fathom eating it again.

Elephant Sushi is not like that AT ALL. Every roll was made to perfection.

The only downside to this place was they didn't have any miso soup on the menu :( I think this place recently opened so maybe it will be on the menu down the line. 

Also, there weren't many maki rolls to choose from buy the ones that were on the menu were amazing!! The fish was so clean and fresh tasting. It really the best sushi I have had so far! 

The restaurant itself is small but the ambiance really sets the mood in this place. Fun music, dark wood and dimly lit lights transform this place. The hostess working the night we were there was so nice and easy to talk to; almost like you were meeting a friend. Every table was sat but Within 10 minutes of getting there, we were seated and our waiter promptly came over to take our order. We ordered the spicy hamachi, flaming sea bass and boom box( this was a super unique roll with scallop, sweet soy glaze, garlic chips and a banana). Our server was also very understanding when we asked if we could have all the rolls sliced thinly. It might be an odd request but he did so without blinking an eye. Even returning after we received our rolls to see if they were sliced thinly enough. Extra points for also bribing over two sides of spicy mayo so my husband and I wouldn't fight over it.  We were hungry but snacked on the large jar of house made pickled ginger and soy. The rolls came over in record time. We devoured the spicy hamachi while our flaming sea bass cooked away table side. After the fire went out we opened up the tin foil and enjoyed the hot sea bass roll. The flavors were amazing and melted in your mouth. My favorite part was picking at the crispy sticky rice as the bottom of the tin foil that was covered in yummy sauce
The real star to me was the boom box. It is so elegantly put together and the combo of spicy scallops to sweet banana and flavorful garlic chips is a must try!!! 

I can't wait to go back to this place! Also, after your dinner you can take a walk up to swensens for some yummy dessert.
author: Whitney S.

description: I think this is the best sushi I have had in the city. My boyfriend and I came on a Sunday night around 7:30 and we only had to wait 30 minutes before getting a table. The atmosphere was very romantic and trendy and we enjoyed our table in the corner by the window. The restaurant was full of people and was a little noisy since it is very small. After our amazing appetizer of the Himalayan Trout, I knew this restaurant was a new favorite. The fish was so fresh and I love the garlic ponzu they put on it.  We followed our appetizer with the white out roll, the red and yellow roll, and the sizzling sea bass roll. The white out was definitely my favorite out of the three because it was very delicate and delicious. The red and yellow roll was good, but the mango in the dish had no flavor and wasn't ripe. The sizzling sea bass was also very delicious and we enjoyed watching it cook right in front of us. We had a wonderful experience and absolutely loved the food. We will be coming back very soon!!
author: Kelly M.

description:
I love Elephant Sushi.  It's got unique rolls and the quality of their fish is great.. 

HOWEVER - a big HOWEVER, their fish is slightly warm for me.  I love my sashimi on the cold side.  Their fish is slightly cooler than room temperature.  I'm not sure if that's normal or just a style of serving sashimi.  So with that fact,  I hesitate to keep going back.  I've been back about 4 times, but the more I go, the more I realize, I just want my sashimi cold, not room temperature.

If they change this one thing, it would be a 5 star place for me.
author: Lyly N.

description: I flew in from vegas to spend the weekend, yelped sushi in San Fransisco by my Marriot at the the wharf....Elephant Sushi popped up with great reviews. I walked as it was only 1/2 mile.....well....it was all up hill, steep hill....lol worth it all though, service was great and the food was as good if not better than the high end sushi bars in Vegas.....thanks guys..
author: Bill Y.

description:
I had been itching to try this new place and I finally did about a month ago.  After reading all the rave reviews, I'm definitely a believer.  

What we ate:
-Albacore Tataki on Rock Salt - White tuna on a slab of rock salt.
-Kobe Dragon Roll - Possibly a CA roll with seared Kobe beef laying on top.
-Flaming Seabass - Served over a blue flame, a cool experience in and of itself.
-White Out Roll - Yellowtail and avocado roll topped with seared butter fish with garlic ponzu sauce

I was not disappointed by any of the items. All tasted extremely fresh. 

I sat at the bar, so met the owner and his brother.  Super friendly and was told their menu changes based on whatever is fresh and in season. I also shared that I was not a fan of uni.  The owner persuaded me to give it another chance and offered a small sample of it to me and it wasn't too bad.  He suggested I get the "Beastie Boys" next time, which I believe has a slab of uni in it and I'm not too opposed to giving it another chance.

Would I come back? Absolutely.  

Advice: Beware of long waits and try not to bring a big group.  I think groups of 4 would be best.
author: Dolores L.

description:
So seeing how everyone on here has raved about this place I decided I should go give it a try. Walking in, I noticed the nice dark decor which looked quite welcoming. So from there it should of been a good night of food and drink or so I thought...

So lets talk service... From the get go the service was sub par, I don't expect quick snap snap service but when you walk by without even a glance while I raise my hand to have my order taken? Yea thats not very nice... Other than that, I could care a bit less for the service.

So lets go food instead...so browsing through the menu I see a bunch of interesting items..And the ordering commences - 

- Hamachi Truffle - ok this can be good, but PLEASE lay off the truffle oil! You are drowning the fish and its taste! How unfortunate...sometimes less is more..

- Whiteout - seared butterfish...hamachi..avocado..garlic ponzu. Now this would of been really good, but no it fell down flat too. Searing the fish with the torch can bring out different flavors. I can't taste the flavors though when you've overdone it and all I taste is the remnants of the gas from your torch. Whoa..another flop..what?!

- Seared Mackerel - ok something really struck me hard now when I ate this dish. First off there really was not much of it. Mackerel is not an expensive fish, it is actually considered to some as the "poor" mans fish. But the flavors on mackerel can be quite simple but exquisite at times if done right. UNFORTUNATELY this dish did not do very well. The mackerel was overpowered once again with the remnants of gas and too much of this strange sauce. *sigh*

By this time I was quite displeased with my visit. I spent money on food that should of been good but was unoriginal and poor in taste. It actually makes me pretty upset. I mean think about it, you go out expecting a night of some good food and drink and you end up with a stomach that is full from food that was not even sub-par. And worst of all you had to pay for it....

Funny thing is that after writing this review and reminiscing it hit me that I have ordered these exact three dishes at Saru Sushi Bar in Noe Valley...from the torched mackerel that I raved about there to the Hamachi Truffle. Now if I am not mistaken something seems a bit strange, already execution was a miss, as well as the presentation...but using the same names? I dont know...coincidence? I dont really think so..

Well, I don't want to go back to Elephant Sushi to find out but if I'm going to get my fix of those dishes with some fresh fish especially the torched Mackerel I'm heading over to Saru Sushi Bar instead...
author: phillip w.

description:
I've been to Elephant Sushi at least 4-5 times since I wrote my first review, and I the hostess and waitstaff has been extremely pleasant every.single.time. The only issue I had with this place before was that the wait staff was pretty dismissive of its patrons, but they've really changed their tune and the hostess is awesome-- she's straightforward, friendly and really does what she can to get you seated. Elephant Sushi, you've earned yourself an extra star.

I wrote before about how amazing the sushi is, but every time I go back it seems better. It's literally the best sushi I've ever had. It's so fresh and the rolls are really unique. You can taste every single flavor, and it's just so good. I'm salivating writing this... definitely try it out!
author: Kate B.

description:
Anything you get here is a treat.  You can't go wrong.


I love sitting at the bar and watching the sushi come out so you can ask what looks appetizing to you!


Very good choice of music in there too!
author: J V.

description:
Elephant Sushi is pretty small, but a cool little space. All dark walls with the sushi bar with chefs in the background with a lit kitchen behind them. On a Sunday night a table for 2 was seated pretty quickly, even though the rest of the restaurant was packed. 

They have house pickled ginger (thick and yummy!) on the table and an extensive menu with a ton of rolls to choose from. My friend got two rolls and they were delicious! The fish was fresh and the ingredients all blended together nicely. I got the poke salad which was filling and the fish was fresh as well. They even have a soju drink called "Hello Kitty cocktail." Naturally, I got it- and it was good. 

Service was quick and concise, nothing to fluffy or frilly, but efficient. For a local sushi joint, I'd come back to Elephant Sushi for sure. 

**don't forget to write/draw on the feedback paper, as they'll post it up in the window  :)
author: Christine A.

description: Good food, nice staff, but not quite worth sitting outside for an hour on a Thursday evening.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Found the place on yelp, and was very excited to find that a reservation for 12 was taken at 430 pm on a Saturday night. It was about a 20 minute walk from pac heights.

Came in to find a nice table set up in the back half of the restaurant. Water was poured right away, but putting the drink and food order in took another 25-30 minutes. However, other than this initial moderate wait time, the rest of the service was high quality.

Great vibe for a weekend night:
- Loud electronic( daft punk-esque) music blasting
- $2 sake bombs all night long!
- Funny host, and waiters super tolerant of a loud sake bombing group

The sushi might not have been super traditional e.g. Boom box roll, Green machine roll..., but it was very well done. I personally had the spicy tuna-$7, and the kobe dragon-$15. The tuna was melt in your mouth and for the price, a steal. The kobe dragon was a pretty unique mix of mildly sweet relish, mint flavors, backed by a crunchy and creamy cucumber/avocado interior, with the saltier seared beef on top. One of the chefs personally brought this dish out, which I thought was a nice touch. For the $15 you do get 8 rolls, so I would give the recommendation, especially for the non sashimi eating type. 

Anyways, two big thumbs up!
author: Moose T.

description:
Elephant Sushi is a hidden gem in Russian Hill and is a top tier sushi restaurant. This little nook is always packed, and unless you arrive before 6:00 PM, you need to prepare for a wait. Thats OK though since Bacchus and Cafe Meuse wine bars are both up the street.

Their menu is in three main parts: Elephant Sushi creations, rolls, and sashimi. I love their rolls and sashimi, but their creations are what truly differentiates this restaurant.

I highly recommend their New Zealand Ocean Trout cured on Himalayan Rock Salt and topped with scallions. Delicious! Their hamachi truffle is a huge hit, and often served as a quick appetizer while you're perusing the menu.  You also can't go wrong with the tuna belly if it's on special--this is pretty much the bacon of the sea. Incredible. 

Make it a priority to visit Elephant Sushi while you're in Russian Hill. Hyde Street has so many delicious spots, and Elephant Sushi is a unique addition to this quintessential San Francisco street.
author: Brooke S.

description:
Good service and great sushi!

Order the flaming sea bass - it is delicious and part of the Elephant Sushi experience.

$2 sake bombers are just one sake glass and small beer.  It's really just one sake bomber, so don't expect a big Sapporo and large hot sake :-)

If there is a wait it's OK since there is a wine bar just two doors away and Elephant will call you when your table is ready.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
I had dinner here while visiting San Francisco. I got there 10 minutes after opening and since I was a solo diner I got a seat at the bar right away. Lucky for me I was sat next to another business traveler and we decided to split sushi to enhance our experience. 

We ordered the Hamachi Truffle, the whiteout roll, flaming sea bass and assorted sashimi. Everything was AMAZING!! The sashimi was melt in your mouth - as was everything. My absolute favorite is the hamachi truffle. It was so good we got 2! On top of being so amazingly delicious it was very affordable. I wish I had a place like this near home. I'd be there all of the time.
author: Melody D.

description:
Hip new sushi joint that has the Marina feel in Russian Hill, but with not so hip service.

While the inside is tiny and all tables except for one is in sight, it took a while to order. On the other hand, I noticed they were attentive with filling our waters. 

I tried the white out roll, Giant's roll and 49er's roll. The quality of fish was mediocre, and I found each roll lacking in flavor (although one of them had a kick of lemon in it). 

Parking in the area is difficult, take a taxi!
author: Emily C.

description: Yum!!! Had a wonderful nite there this past Friday. We ordered the flaming sea bass, hamachi appetizer and a bottle of Sake. Overall the staff was amazing! They are all incredibly nice and attentive. To me although, the sushi was just average.
author: Lara S.

description:
I wanted to come out of my Yelp hiatus for my new favorite neighborhood joint! I had the pleasure of dining here last week when my rents were in town and had the even greater pleasure of meeting one of the owners, Neesa (I hope I spelled that right). She kindly explained that her and Tom opened the joint a little over a month ago in hopes of drawing in a loyal crowd. They decorated the space with hand-picked shells (laid out in fish motifs all over the walls), made unique chandeliers and used mixed wood for a casual, yet intimate vibe.

Now onto the food- they have $2 sake bomb happy hours (which just sounds dangerous and reminiscent of my early and mid-20s in NYC), a delicious truffle hamachi amuse bouche (that was incredibly sizable) and an array of creative rolls and seafood. 

Their food is FRESH. On top of innovative rolls, they also have incredible sashimi- generous portions of buttery goodness. I had the Walu, Salmon and Tuna last time I was there and I left craving more. I actually went back hoping to show my boyfriend the place but they are CLOSED on Mondays. Oh well, everybody's gotta rest. Mental note. 

They are accommodating and warm and even ask customers to write reviews after dinner, which they post on their door. Talk about bringing Yelp to life! :)

I'm really hoping that as their client and fan bases grow, they will continue to stick to the basics- simple and beautiful decor, a warm hospitable staff, and incredibly fresh and great deals on food. 

Pretty please?
author: Lianne Z.

description:
I really wish Yelp allowed 0 starts, b/c that is what I would give this place. 

We came here because of the good Yelp reviews looking forward to eat some great sushi. If not great, at least normal. Right away, there were warning signs. The service was horrible. We had to waive down a waitress just to even get the menu. 

It wasn't officially on the menu, but I asked for a California roll. The waitress said they don't make California rolls. Seriously?! I then pointed out that the Rainbow roll is described as California Roll + fish on top - they don't have to put fish on it, and it'll be a California roll! She checked with the chef, and said they'll make it. I then asked to make sure to put tobiko on it. 

My California roll was brought out first, way before anyone else's food was brought. So I sat there awkwardly not eating until everyone else finally got their food. Of course, my California roll didn't have any tobiko on it, so I had to ask them to go add it. 

So now to the eating part. I thought maybe the service is not good, but the food must be good! The sushi tasted horrible. It is really rare to have bad sushi, but this was bad sushi. The cucumber in my roll was clearly not ripe and it had this weird lemony flavor. It was actually bad.
