I didn't order anything else for the rest of the night, but I feel absolutely horrible now, like I have food poisoning or something. I shouldn't have finished the roll. 

My friends had a very similar experience. Everything they ordered wasn't very good, but they kept ordering since they were hungry and the check was huge. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!
author: Natasha M.

description: All the fish they use for the sushi are fresh and tasty. I tried Albacore Tataki, Hamachi Truffle, and White out and loved all three dishes. Can't wait to go back and try different rolls/plates.
author: Jenn M.

description:
We all know the sushi is immaculate. It truly is incredible. But the popularity is going to their head.

FYI: you can no longer make a reservation for a party of 4. Only 2, and only at 6pm. 

That's a bummer because the place can only seat two parties of 4; one up front, and one at the communal table in the back.

I live right around the corner. Loved this place. But now, when my parents come into town, and want to eat at Elephant with my wife and I, it means being first in line, waiting out front to beat the tourists. #firstworldproblems
author: Tyler C.

description: Best sushi I've had in the city! I saw some other reviews remarking on their service and claiming it was rushed and rude. That absolutely was not the experience I've had at Elephant. They are accommodating, constantly smiling, and they are kings of sushi! I highly recommend the Ya Man Roll, the Himalayan Trout, and the Flaming Sea Bass
author: Dylan P.

description: I give this place 4 stars instead of 5 because it's hours are pretty horrible. I've never been to a restaurant that only stays open about 4hrs a day. I guess they make good money to run a successful business on 4 hrs a day. The sushi was really good though. Moderate in price. The Flaming Sea Bass is really good. Nice presentation. The Godzilla Roll is small but very good as well and the Double Albacore is excellent. Good place to eat outside of the busy area of union square.
author: King N.

description: SF favorite! Love the Ya Man roll, and just about everything. Small and their waiting list system and hours suck but the food makes up for it and keeps me coming back
author: Atli T.

description:
I first went to Elephant Sushi in late September and was already WOW'd by their soft launch menu. Having returned last weekend to an extensive (but not yet finished?!) dinner menu I am amazed at the progress. Their Godzilla Roll is amazing!! This inventive shrimp tempura wrapped in ahi tuna is so good I almost wished we had ordered two. Please keep this on the final menu!! (or don't?? and just make it for me??) Our on-the-house Truffle Hamachi sampler was also jaw dropping delicious. 

I'm an SO ecstatic to have such an amazing sushi place in my neighborhood. The vibe is great for a fun date or a group of friends hungry for sushi and thirsty for $2 sake bombs!
author: Sarah Z.

description: Delicious fresh sushi with an equally stellar setting (small, romantic, not too noisy). I am also highly addicted to their homemade pickled ginger, but watch out as it's hot. We had a delicious off-menu vegetarian roll along with a nice avocado and crushed sesame roll and a rainbow role. Everything was delicious and the rice was not over-present in the rolls.
author: Erin W.

description:
Wow is about the only word that completely describes the food at this intimate eatery.  I will personally recommend the Flaming Sea Bass and Walu Carpaccio, which are unbelievable.  After that, just go with your server's recommendations.  They generally know best.

And speaking of service, Emannuel could not have been nicer.  My fiance and I were overwhelmed by his professionalism and extremely pleasant demeanor.  We feel lucky to have been waited on by him.

As I mentioned earlier, the place is pretty small - so go with reservations.  And enjoy!
author: Patrick C.

description:
I so badly wanted to give this place 5 stars, 6 stars if I could. The food is absolutely delicious and my first few experiences were great, but I can't after my last visit to Elephant sushi. 


I came here with five of my friends for my birthday dinner a month or so ago. We were the first in line since the wait is always over an hour. I was super excited to take my friends from out of town here. We told the host that we had 6 people in our party and she told us they didn't seat parties larger than 4. We asked if we can sit in a certain area that could possibly fit all of us, but it was reserved. We asked if we could put tables together and they refused because that was their policy and the size of the place isn't very big. We were very frustrated because they have a large table in the back that probably fits 8 people but they wouldn't sit us there. Instead they sat 4 of us at the large table and the rest of us close by, but not close enough to enjoy and engage with our friends. Then they sat 2 random ladies next to our group of 4, which makes no sense at all! The place wasn't even full! After a few minutes, the 2 ladies got up and told us they were leaving the restaurant and offered us their seats. We continued to ask the servers if they could sit us together. We knew they felt bad but it wasn't up to them. The lady, who I believe is the owner kept saying "NO! Absolutely not!" She was so unbelievably inconsiderate and wouldn't accommodate us what so ever. She was being very passive aggressive saying "you don't have to eat here if you don't want to." I wanted to punch her in the face for her attitude and lack of customer service. After all this hassle, we got up and left. She gave us a fake ass smile and said "have a good night." 

I work in a very high end salon in San Francisco. I talk to a lot of people every single day. I've raved to many of my clients about this place, but now I refuse to recommend this place because of the service of the owner. I will never return to this restaurant. No matter how good the food is, if the customer service sucks, it's not worth it!
author: Valerie N.

description:
I love food and will hunt down the best food in any town I live in or visit.  With that said, it was a fantastic surprise the other night to find Elephant sushi on Yelp, make a random Thursday night visit and have one of the most memorable meals of the year.

We called and put our name on the waiting list.  The hostess (who is the owner) was super friendly and when we arrived told us that we had three two tops ahead of us and said she would call.  We walked to the wine bar up the street and chilled.  We got a call and she asked if we wanted the sushi bar.  Hell ya.. love to talk to the Chef.  Turns out he was also the owner!  The food was delicious, the fish super fresh and if you must try the beastie boys roll.  Absolutely delicious.  We told him to just keep serving us food until we couldn't eat another bite.  Everything was fresh, tasty and original.  The NZ Ocean trout was delicious!

Sake on the list is focused and just the right number of beers.  Overall, this is my new go to sushi place for the food and for the people.  If you are feeling like a great sushi meal, make the effort to visit Elephant!
author: Carnet W.

description: One of the best sushi places in the the city of San Fran Food is Great place is little too small but service and food compensates the small space
author: Tony V.

description:
This place does not disappoint!

Tips:
1. Make a reservation. This place is always packed
2. Rolls to order: White Out  and Red & Yellow. 

The service is impeccable. The fish is super fresh. They're very creative with their fusion style of rolls. Honestly, it's a Russian Hill GEM!
author: Valerie Y.

description: The oyster shooters were the best and more unique thing that I've had from a sushi bar before. Definitely worth the trip just for them.
author: Eric J.

description:
Great find in my local hood. The menu is very creative, I highly recommend the Beastie Boy and the White Out roll. The hamachi with truffle oil was also amazing. 

The sashimi was fresh and good but very thickly cut. Since the restaurant is relatively new service was a little scattered but this is easily forgivable once you taste the food.  This is definitely a spot to check out!
author: Ryan J.

description:
Woah. What a welcome addition to Hyde Street and the general void in the Nob/Russian/North Beach area between cheap, questionably fresh sushi and ultra-pricey, 'is that really a roll?' spots like Okoze across the street. 

Elephant Sushi is amazing. Service was very attentive - though we went early (6 pm) and the whole space was filled by the time we left 1.5 hours later. Our waiter was helpful in letting us know what the more popular dishes were on the menu, and within 5 minutes of sitting down one of the chefs behind the sushi bar sent out a sea bass/pepper/ponzu sashimi plate (the Suzuki) on the house. Pair that with the discovery of a $2 sake bomb all night happy hour, as well as their amazing house-made ginger & soy sauce, and dinner was off to a great start.

We ordered the Crudo starter, double hamachi roll, assorted sashimi and the flaming sea bass, and all four were outstanding. I'm not the biggest fan of truffle oil, as most applications overpower whatever else you're trying to eat, but the hamachi truffle combo in the Crudo was done well. The scallops used for the Crudo, paired with a few drops of fresh lemon juice, were possibly my favorite flavors of the night.

The sashimi, as all other reviews have already covered, is outstanding - huge cuts of fish sliced expertly, and so fresh you can almost taste the ocean. To give you a sense of the freshness of the fish each night, we arrived right as they opened and the two chefs behind the counter were unwrapping dozens of just-packaged fillets straight from the market before arranging them under the glass.

Final notes - the double hamachi & flaming sea bass are so drastically different from each other that it's hard to compare, but if getting the flaming sea bass I'd recommend saving it for last as it's a much bolder combo of flavors than the lighter fish-focused rolls. Both were incredible, though I enjoyed the Hamachi more, and the portions are generous for the price.

I think my GF said it best in her comment card: 'Elephant Sushi, I love you. Please don't change.' Assuming they maintain the portions, pricing, menu and momentum they've established in these first few months, I'll be looking forward to every meal here. And there will be lots.
author: Alan C.

description:
I have always recommended Elephant Sushi to friends as we love the food and it's a great spot. 

The other day however was such an awful experience. First of all our table was given away even though we were there on time and were just waiting for our friend to arrive (who was only minutes behind us). Then we got a table right at the back in the dark because of this.

Then later on, we ordered another drink, we finished our meal and the check was brought over immediately, too quickly, as we hadn't finished their drinks. 

Ten mins later the rude owner/hostess asked us to finish up as the next people were waiting! She had not said that there was a time limit on the table when we sat down and we had not been there for very long! When we said we were still finishing our drinks, she went away. Then a few mins later she came back and said 'i have to ask you to leave'!

This is the first time we have ever been thrown out of a restaurant! We were still drinking drinks purchased there and yet she threw us out, so rude!! 

I will not be recommending again.
author: Matilda E.

description:
My friends and I dined here last night. We knew immediately that it was good because as soon as the doors opened there was a line. We had gotten there about 40 minutes earlier but were told they weren't open yet so we hit up the wine/saki bar pretty much next door. By the time we came back we had barely made the first round of seating, but the hostess was awesome and got us in!

We each ordered a glass of wine and quickly agreed on the chips and dip, which was delicious. We had seen from the sticky notes that the Flaming Sea Bass was amazing so we had to get it. It was my favorite of all that we ordered. The presentation was pretty cool and the sushi was definitely hot! I had never had warm sushi before. 

We also had the Boom Box, Ya Man, and one more that I can't remember the name, but it was spicy. Both of my friends loved all of them, but I didn't particularly like the Boom Box because it had a sweetness that I didn't care for. 

Seems like an American-take on sushi so if you're looking for authentic I would check the menu first. If you're looking for really great tasting food then eat here!
author: Erin B.

description: One of my favorite sushi spots in SF. Very fresh fish, small place, love the atmosphere.
author: Jiyoung K.

description:
Elephant Sushi is still making amazing food and is such a welcome spot on Hyde Street. We continually keep coming back and have not been disappointed!

My favorite dish is the Himalayan Trout on the rock salt. Its so fresh and such an interesting dish to order. I also love the sashimi famers salad that is loaded with fish and goodies. The double hamachi roll is pretty darn good too!

Sake bombs are a dangerous $2/each - which is usually my drink of choice. 

Elephant Sushi also has an amazing staff. They are both knowledgeable and friendly. Overall, one of our favorite places to eat in the neighborhood.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Best Sushi I've ever had! Creative and well executed dishes with amazing flavor. And the prices are incredible for what you get... plus... have the hostess choose the dishes for you. Believe me, you will not be disappointed and will want to make many trips back. I love this place!

Btw... It's small and usually busy so don't fret the wait and u probably don't want to go on a busy night to catch up with old or new friends... Get your food... Enjoy... And dip ;-)
author: roderick h.

description:
Wow. Just wow. 

Absolutely amazing. Hands-down, the best Toro sashimi Ive ever had -- with very generous cuts of fish. All the sashimi plates looked amazing - I have to try more of a variety next time.

Rolls to get:
Flaming Sea Bass - inventive and oh-so-good!
White Out - Butterfish. That is all that needs to be said.
Ya Man Roll - Pesto and fish? Yes, it works. Trust me.

The unfiltered sake is also not to be missed, and every table features house-pickled ginger. 

I travel to SF often, and this is definitely going on my list of places to become a regular!
author: Nick P.

description: Almost a year after my initial review, I can now say that Elephant Sushi is (hands down) my favorite sushi spot in SF. My mind (and stomach, naturally) are blown every single time I come here and, if you can imagine, it just keeps getting better. The White Out roll is still incredible and the Walu nigiri is to die for. I could literally eat these as my last meal on earth. In food heaven right now!!
author: Amy G.

description: Elephant Sushi - where fresh and creative meet.  This place is pretty small and it's not cheap, but the food is nothing short of awesome.  Great for a romantic date or small group dinner.  Best items so far have been the Ya Man, Crudo, & Godzilla rolls.  Also, they have real Wasabi (not the horseradish most other sushi spots offer) and a decent wine list.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Bud L.

description: I've been to many sushi joints around the country and I place this lineup in the top ten. Super fresh and friendly service. A bit of a wait on the front in but food was delivered shortly after ordering. Considering the wait outside, they don't rush you and encourage to take your time in trying the favorites. I loved the Hamachi Truffle, Himalayan Trout, Flaming SeaBass. Everyone I saw in the restaurant had the SeaBass on their table it looked like. Expect a wait. We went to the wine bar next door to wait for our call but took an hour to get in.
author: Chase L.

description: This place completely changed the way I felt about sushi. Awesome flavour combinations and decent sized portions served. It's hard to choose which one to get! Overall atmosphere is fun although I feel the place is more suited to smaller parties and on occasion have had to wait a while for a table but I think it is well worth it in the end and there's a great wine bar just up the road to wait at until your table is ready. Worth mentioning the sake bombs too - only $2 per drink.
author: Olivia C.

description:
Four Stars

1 & 2 FOOD IS FRESH, CREATIVE AND DELICIOUS 
3-Hostess is fantastic
4-Awesome ambiance


Minus one star for horrible service. Like really bad, Im sure they mean well, but either they were understaffed or just dont know how to wait tables. but Im patient and ill come back.

p.s. they have tamari!!! GLUTEN FREE safe zone!!!


new fav sushi in the city
author: Lauryn S.

description:
Things I LOVE:
1. They give generous fish portion on their nigiri sushi.
2. rolls are large and creative
3. Sea bass roll was AMAZING...roll is cooked in front of you on a bed of alcohol. Roll is super tender, full of flavor...I can 2 of those on my own.
4. price is very reasonable for quality sushi.

Note: street parking only...which is tough in russian hill. 
Place is small, simple, no frill. Make sure to make reservation!
author: Nancy Z.

description: The best sushi restaurant in SF in my opinion based on trying about 20 others.  The only catch is that they do not take reservations unless you want to be seated at 6PM.  It makes for a fun evening to put your name on the list and wait at a local wine bar for a bit.
author: Matt M.

description:
WARNING.....


Eating here will make it really hard to want to eat sushi anywhere else. 

The food is just that good. There isn't anything I have tried I did not like. 

The tip I will give to you is this... make a reservation. And if you don't that is cool too... but it is worth the wait.

Cheers!
author: Lollie S.

description:
I myself like variety! I love going to different sushi bars and comparing typical rolls. For instance my usual is a salmon skin roll and i love to see how other sushi bars top others for this one roll. 

1) $2 all day sake bombs
2) ambience is great! 
3) SUPER FRIENDLY! i dont think ive been to many sushi bars where everyone personally greets
author: Jamie L.

description: Remarkable, modern and inventive sushi offerings. Be Aware that you must have a reservation or will risk a wait due to the popularity and tiny size of this venue.
author: Jean L.

description:
Wow! From start to finish I was impressed by this restaurant. I came here with friends on my birthday because we wanted to try something new. Let's just say we rolled the dice on a jackpot. 

For starters, I LOVE sake bombs and this place has them for $2. Yes, seriously two dollars. That alone blew my mind and made me happy. I don't know if they'll be able to keep offering them at that price forever, but it's freaking awesome right now. 

Then there's the amazing service from server to chef. Our server was very attentive and super friendly. The owner/chef caught word that it was my birthday and sent us a surprise round of soju lychee martinis - they were terrific and the gesture was much appreciated. It also goes to show that this place really cares about its customers.

Ok and then there's the Flaming Sea Bass Roll - YUMMMMM! It comes out as described, flaming. Once the flame goes out, the flavor inside leaves you craving more and more. I only had one minor comment of improvement for them on this roll - to work to make it stick together a little better. Given how seriously they take customer comments, I'm sure they've already fixed this. 

That's another thing, they ask for customer feedback. They're all about continuous improvement. This also impresses me. I wish more restaurants listened to their customers. 

Overall, I can easily give this place 5 stars. I've been recommending this place to friends and continue to hear positive responses from each friend that goes. Will be returning again very soon!
author: Kristin H.

description: Some of the highest quality sushi i've had in SF.   Had the Omakase sashimi, Himalayan Trout,  and Beastie Boys.  Very light on rice and lots of great flavors.  We got there about 15 minutes before 6 on a Sunday and was probably the 4th group let in.  Most everyone who got there before 6 did get in.  Service was very good, I'll probably go back there again.
author: Sonny R.

description:
For all the talk of elephant sushi, I wasn't impressed.  

Food - tons of rolls & nothing super interesting.  I assumed this place would offer something more traditional or unique, but it very much caters to customers that load up on rolls and don't appreciate real sushi.  Overall quality of the fish was good.

Service - we (my husband and I) walked in at 6pm on Sat night and were surprised to get a seat at the sushi bar, but that's where the good service ended.  Once we finished our sushi orders (still had a drink to finish!) the hostess immediately brought us our check.  The server came over and apologetically encouraged us to stay and finish our beers.  As soon as we settled the check the hostess was over again, cleaning up our area and hinting that we should be on our way.  As we were finishing our beer, it wasn't more than 2 mins after we settled the bill that the hostess came over to us (again!) and said. "um, excuse me, I've already called the next party for this spot."  Really?  After spending over $100, you're going to have the nerve to kick me out and tell me when its time for me to leave?  I could understand if we had been there chatting for another 30-45 mins and not ordered anything else, but that wasn't what happened.  We were told we needed to leave immediately after we paid the bill.

I walked out of the restaurant and told my husband I will NEVER be back again.  If it were just for the non-impressive sushi, there's a chance I'd be back, but after being kicked out by the hostess that obviously knows nothing about customer service or the power of repetitive business, there's no chance I'll be back.
author: Kate G.

description:
Great sushi in a cool, intimate atmosphere. And $2 sake bombs.

Pro-tip: The tables are small, so pour the sake into your beer instead of dropping it. I was overzealous and got beer all up in our wasabi.

Himalayan Salted Trout was delicious, by far the highlight of the meal. They serve it to you on a huge block of salt, then you coat the fish yourself. The radish was a nice touch.

The Flaming Sea Bass was fun in an experiential kind of way. It was delicious (really tender + fatty), I mostly liked it because they serve it over a bowl of fire. 

We ordered the Boom Box because I wanted to see what the deal was with banana sushi. I was underwhelmed, would recommend going with some other special roll that catches your eye.
author: Ryan D.

description: The food was amazing!! If you love fresh sushi you will love this place..the only problem I had with this restaurant is the parking it's very hard to find a spot in that neighborhood. Still haven't had sushi this good in a long time def worth the trouble..
author: Pat B.

description: Awesome! Awesome place with really unique, and delicious rolls. They got a cool sake bomb special too! Yes there is a line, but it is worth the wait. Absolutely one of the best sushi I had many years trying restaurant here in the city. The give you home made ginger, and some rolls are made on your table sort of, they get this roll wrapped in foil, they put it in a bowl then light the bowl on fire and then undo the foil and bam its a lightly toasted from the top roll. Definitely coming back for more!
author: Try E.

description:
The hamachi was amazing. The bluefin tuna was fresh and prepared really well. The ambiance is chill and staff were friendly.

Considering the price, it's a spectacular experience.  

Will definitely come back.
author: Farid F.

description: Very good experience.  Hostess was awesome, I got there right as they started to get busy but my date was a bit late, meanwhile the hostess was great about getting us right in even after a line started to build up after.  Food was very tasty and service was great!
author: Kyle C.

description:
I really enjoyed eating here. There not your typical sushi place. They don't have edamame or miso soup or gzyoza. There rolls are basically all specialty. This place reminds me of a up class no bullshit joint. Strictly sushi. 

The place is small so make reserataions.
author: Jess O.

description: I was kind of excited about this place. Its not good. The wait is long. The clientele is prissy and the food is mediocre. I wanted to like it because I'd heard good things about the chef and the service is pretty good. But ultimately it's over priced and if you want good fish don't go here.
author: Miranda B.

description: What sushi restaurant runs out of rice? The hours of operation are posted incorrectly all over the Internet. They will be really rude to you if you show up during posted business hours and expect that you are at a sushi restaurant, because they don't have any rice. Or fish. Maintaining pars in the kitchen is a very basic management skill. Yikes. Domo arigato for nothing.
author: C. F.

description:
What a great experience! Elephant Sushi is truly for your Gourmet Sushi Foodie! 

Soft opening and a great atmosphere. Tom and his staff are amazing and he is by far the best Sushi Chef. I don't know anyone who is more creative with Sushi.

We tried everything on the menu and it was all fabulous!

Keep up the good job and may the place be filled with happy people every night!
author: Anette A.

description: Fantastic meal. Flaming sea bass was amazing from presentation to taste. Also loved the Hamachi starter and the Red and Yellow Roll. All-around great experience from service to food.
author: Brad P.

description:
I've been here 3 times and have yet to write a review. They open at 6 and only accept reservations at 6.

What to get:
Beastie Boys--Just do it. Bite of heaven.
Yummy Pocket
Ya Man Roll

Hello Kitty martini is only $5 and very strong. 

Tip: Wait at 5:40pm and you will guarantee a table.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
This is the best sushi I've ever had, period. Super fresh, really nice sized portions, not all that expensive considering the great atmosphere and quality fish.

I went twice during a recent four day trip to SF because it was *that* good. Both times we got a free appetizer compliments of the chef/owner. The first time we sat at the sushi bar and chatted with him. This is his third restaurant in the city, I didn't catch the name of his first two. Both visits we enjoyed excellent service, super friendly and helpful staff. Ask for some reccomendations, but everything we had was excellent. I'd suggest the more "adventerous" rolls and appetizers, the "regular" (spicy tuna, etc) are good but not out-of-this-world like some of the specialty items. It's worth the extra few bucks!

Some of the 'special' dishes are served on himalayan salt blocks, which was just *amazing*. Really creative, great presentation, added a great flavor.

Compared to eating sushi in other cities - we have a pretty famous sushi place here in Denver called 'Sushi Den' that's actually more expensive than Elephant Sushi, and tastes like gas station sushi comparatively. And Sushi Den doesn't suck by any non-SF standard.

I'm hesitant to write this review, as the place is small and I want to be able to get a reservation next time I'm in SF!
author: Casey S.

description: OK. Worst experience EVER! We went with my sister, was the last night of my sister here in San Francisco given that she was visiting. We went to this place around 9:15pm. There was an available table in front of us, the girl was saying that they were already closed, she said the table was available but they were already closed + running out of rise. How could be that possible? Elephant sushi running OUT OF RICE? And she said the place was closed, but the door was open an in Yelp they say they close at 10pm, not at 9:15pm. I showed her that but she doesn't care. After she said they were running out of rice, I told her I could have just sake and sashimi then,  rolls with no rice. But she said that they were close. So I don't know then, if she was trying to give us different excuses or what, but it was not a good experience, at all.
author: Maria O.

description: I met up with my buddy to go to this sushi place that he comes to once a week. The place is very small and cozy but there is a long waiting list an hour after opening. I thought this place must be good. I let my buddy do all the ordering since he eats here so much. We ordered a plate of sashimi, beastie boys, and flaming sea bass roll,  boom box roll and a sake martini. The ones that stood out were the beastie boys and flaming sea bass. The beastie boy sushi is unique. I believe it has monk fish liver, uni and rice. It was so good and it's something no other sushi place has. The flaming sea bass was awesome. It comes wrapped in foil over a dish filled with oil. The waitress lights it up and we see it cook for 7 minutes or so. Then the waitress comes back and takes it out and puts it on a plate. I got to say this is truely one of their signature dishes. Plus the chef shows his New York style by using warm rice on the sushi rolls. The sake martini is also a kicker. It's the perfect drink to accompany your meal. The customer service is great here and the employees are friendly. I cannot wait to come back here again.
author: Jon N.

description: Probably the best sushi have had in SF. Himalayan trout and whiteout roll were my favorite. Really small place you should make a reservation.
author: Hila S.

description: Growing up in SF, everyone always asks me if I know any good places for sushi. I never had an answer, UNTIL NOW. I love Elephant Sushi. Hamachi Truffle and White Out are melt-in-my-mouth favs. I hope they never remove that from the menu. Hello Kitty Martini wasn't what I thought it would be (I anticipated it to taste less like alcohol) and if you're trying to do a sake bomb on the communal table, watch out because it's marble -  although it's totally still possible. Anyway I would totally love to go here everyday if I could.
author: Sandy T.

description: House-made ginger, house-made soy sauce, romantic and swanky decor, new menus printed daily!!!
author: Kate S.

description: No doubt best sushi in town! Go for the top ones on the menu and it will be great! Service is good as well. Keep in mind waiting is usually 45 mins. Flaming sea bass is my favorite!
author: Wouter K.

description: Seared butterfish with truffle oil. Need I say more? The dishes are so tasty! The sashimi is crave worthy! I could go on and on. The menu is a bit different than your average sushi joint, and I love the fact that the chefs have brought this creativity to their food. Plus with $2 sake bombs for happy hour (which is all night!), makes this a place I will definitely being going back to very often!
author: Chanel R.

description: This small and friendly neighborhood sushi restaurant is strictly for nigiri lovers. You won't find edamame, miso soup or chicken teriyaki on the menu. Instead there are delicious rolls like the red dragon and perfect nigiri including the trout, hamachi, otoro and always sublime uni. It's never fishy or metallic tasting. It's my Cheers and I love it!
author: Nicola L.

description: Wow! So delicious!! I just love this fresh sushi! I sitting there right now and enjoying every moment! The sushi is awesome fresh and tasty also the service is great. I'll probably come back again!
author: Michal E.

description: If you're willing to spend the money, this is your spot. I can never get enough, so flavorful and extremely fresh. Their salmon roll and butterfish is delicious! The only downside is the ginger is mediocre, and I kind of love ginger.
author: Brittney B.

description: Excellent Sushi! Fresh fish and very unique dishes!!! I went last night and thought the wait was going to be long but we were seated within 15 minutes. The hostess is very friendly, the overall service is very good.
author: Monica C.

description:
I miss my local Sushi Groove but this place has better service and fresher fish.

Enough said.
author: Sharon M.

description:
As a sushi fiend that may or may not carry around chopsticks in her purse, I think I'm qualified to say that Elephant Sushi is my favorite spot in San Francisco. I've tried them all, and this place not only has oversized jars of house-made ginger (a ginger addict's dream), but the staff makes you feel like you just went to your Japanese grandmother's house for supper. They joke, they prod, and they lay down a mean SF Giants roll that made my tastebuds do a few backflips. The Poke comes in a large bowl and is worth the $16-18. For those that shy from the slimy raw selections, the Flaming Sea Bass is delectable. The portions are generous, they have beer on tap, and the intimate, well-designed setting is perfect for dining with friends, lovers, and even tinder dates.

The sushi wizards are known to give you a free sample of something they whip up on the side, so I recommend sitting at the sushi bar. Also, arrive early. The taste-haven can only handle so many starving San Franciscans inside their magical nook.
author: Sam M.

description:
Went here from a friend's recommendation and got there a few minutes before it opened at 6pm. Very nicely decorated spot with a fair amount of seating and a pretty nice casual ambiance that is great for a date. Our server was extremely nice and was really awesome with helping us choose our other plates, since we really only knew about the sushi roll that's on fire (disclaimer: The Flaming Sea Bass is actually just seared using vodka, sake, and salt as fuel for 4 minutes).

I immediately asked about the $2 sake bomb deal since I was having trouble finding it on the menu. Its still honored so that was music to my ears. He even came out with some hamachi on the house from the chef!

We ordered a few things to try and nothing disappointed. Mussels were standard for an appetizer. The hamachi on a rock salt block was pretty deliciously memorable since it was very freshly cut and presented on a huge salty slab. You could rub the slices of fish on the slab to taste. The Flaming Sea Bass was good for a "baked" style roll but I would go for a baked lobster or salmon roll if I was to choose again.

I'd come here again but there were no game changers. Great place to get a bite and drinks with a few friends before going out. The place was packed by the time we left at 7-ish, so come early or be ready to wait.
author: John N.

description:
best sushi i've had in SF. get 1) fish and chips and 2) trout sashimi on sea salt. lots of talk about 3) the flaming sea bass. it was delicious, but it was warm, heavy, creamy and a very different type of dish than everything else. so if you're prepared for that, do it. 

no reso's - long lines. get there early.
author: katy g.

description:
Food -- Great!
Service -- Could be WAY better :/

a.  Had to wait at the front door not knowing if I had to sit down or wait to be seated.   
b.  Asked for recommendations from the staff and after picking just one item the waitress ran away.  I wanted a drink and something else :(((( 
c. Staff WaYYYYY too touchy feely.  I understand you're trying to be friendly but after  5/6 times my arm and shirt is starting to feel like a towel for wiping hands.
d.  Tom the Chef -- great guy, asked him for recommendations and he said he'll add a little something on the house to my order.  Which was great!  EXCEPT when I got the BILL those extra treats that were "on the house" ran me an EXTRA $30!!! WTF!   NOT COOL! NOT COOL AT ALL!

Prices are on the high side.
Trendy looking place.
Expect everything to end up on the bill!!!
author: Gene V.

description:
Brand new sushi restaurant on Hyde. I came here with the girlfriend on a Wednesday night on a whim and were seated right away. The place was about half-full and lively. Appropriately-volumed 80s/90s music in the background and a cozy setting make it comfortable to talk without feeling like either a morgue or a club. The waitress (co-owner) was friendly and chatting, the head chef (co-owner and husband of waitress) came around to the table and said hi and even dropped off a free appetizer to try while we looked at the menu.

The appetizer was a Truffle Hamachi -- the first bit was all truffle which then smoothly dissolved into great fish and citrus flavor, it was delicious.
The Double Hamachi roll -- A good start, but I felt was almost overpowered by citrus flavor drowning out the fish. Still tasty.
The Red and Yellow roll -- Thin mango slices on top of a spicy roll balance out really well, with great presentation in a bowl.
Yellowtail roll - Simple and fresh
Sake nigiri -- Fresh and tasty


Overall the food presentation and style was a more casual, modern sushi with unique ingredients and flavors. Really enjoyed it and will come back.


Currently they are having soft-open until the liquor license is approved, so it is BYOB.
author: Kevin M.

description: The best sushi I had in SF! Extremely nice staff! The wait can be long but is worth it! Erika was the greatest server ever!
author: Clarissa C.

description: A REALLY tiny restaurant that will make you wait 2 hours to be seated.  They only have 3 tables that seat 4, all others seat 2, and they DO NOT move tables around to accommodate.  Once you finally get seated, you HAVE TO get the flaming sea bass roll. That's a culinary experience that will make you want to smack someone.
author: Grace T.

description:
The hostess was great, both over the phone and in person. The waitress on the other hand sucked! She quickly shut me down after I asked about making anything on the menu vegetarian. She recommended kappa and avocado rolls. Really exciting, not.. 

Also my food came like 15 minutes after my friends had already been served their appetizers and entrees. I saw my food come out too and wait there by the chefs, took the waitress like 20 years to realize it.

Also some guy outside bragged about how awesome his customized vegetarian roll was. 


THANKS ELEPHANT.
author: Anisa A.

description: This place is really good!  Got the nigiri assortment, and every piece was fresh, high quality, and delicious.  As for rolls, I recommend the White Out and the Naked Scallop.  Also noted the good ambiance and fun, lively vibe.  All that with a pitcher of Sapporo made for a perfect evening for two!
author: Riz W.

description:
Cool new find for sushi!  Fresh sashimi and inventive dishes like the Flaming Sea Bass!  Check out the pictures and see for yourself!

This is one of those places that you want to transport to your neighborhood.  Lots of success for years to come!
author: Lis A.

description:
I can't remember if I've already rated this place, but if I have, screw it, I'll do it again.  Went here for date night with my nigiri-loving boyfriend.  But at this place, he is all about the rolls.  They are so damn delicious.

We started with the hamachi truffle (it's pretty much hunks of hamachi with truffle oil and shaved black truffle...yes please).  For rolls, we got the flaming sea bass (totally hoky, but TOTALLY delicious...the burnt rice crisps at the bottom are delectable), the white out roll, and the red and yellow (orange and yellow?)  

Also had a couple pieces of nigiri to finish it all off. 

All were out of this world.  

And I finally saved enough room for the banana ice cream. Nomsssssss.

However, as a word to the wise, it does get slammed.  Friday night, I picked my boyfriend up from Bart and we took a lyft directly to Elephant...before they were even open.  We went across the street to Union Larder and had a couple beers (for him) and glasses of wine (for me).  Went back to Elephant around 6:30 and were immediately seated at the sushi bar.
author: Shannon B.

description:
YUM! We were planning on getting Pizza at Za but made a lst minute switch and ate at Elephant sushi. Love this place. The fish is extremely fresh and it melts in your mouth. We ordered the double albacore and acouple other rolls. The double albacore was delightful!! I dont know if i am over exagerating but it was most likely the best sushi i have ever eaten. The owner is usually behind the sushi bar making rolls which i think is an amazing quality control tactic. Everything I have eaten here has not let me down. 

Oh i also read somewhere that the chef at Mission Chinese food goes to elephant sushi as his local go to neighborhood restaurant. pretty cool 

LOVE IT!!
author: Meg C.

description: Great service and an intimate atmosphere. I started out with the Yummy Pockets and had the Beastie Boys for my main dish. The Yummy Pockets were GREAT, and the Beastie Boys was definitely an experience. A good place to go for the adventurous type!
author: Katie P.

description:
I came here this past Wednesday night after some walking exercise on the nearby steep hills, in particular going up the steps along the crooked Lombard Street block and the long series of hills on Hyde Street.  I definitely had an appetite by then and came to this small Japanese place to try it out.

The service was very friendly and the prices weren't too bad (especially compared to the Japanese restaurant located around the corner on Union Street).  One highlight on the menu is the $2 sake bomb served as a "Happy Hour All Night" selection.  You set half a mug of beer and one shot of sake in the typical small sake cup.  As for the food, the sashimi was quite fresh tasting.  However, the roll I ordered (spicy hamachi) was okay but in my mind done in an Americanized style which, not to be too picky, wasn't quite my preference.  Anyway, as I said, that's just me.

Right now, when you dine there, they give you a slip of paper when you give you the check for which they ask you to write your comments.  This slips get posted on the store window, which was one of the first thing I noticed when I came here.
author: H K.

description: This place is AWESOME!!! Delicious Food and excellent Service. We were on vacation visiting from Miami and we found it by mistake riding the Cable Cars, we yelped it and there were mainly good reviews well I believe this place should only have excellent reviews because the food is sooooo FRESH and delicious. Our waitress suggested us rolls and well I thank her because we tried new things that were different and very good. Wish there was a place like this back at Home :s Kudos to owners and Chef! Great place and a must visit on our next trip!!!
author: Emily D.

description: We ordered a couple of sushi rolls but the Himalayan trout and hamachi truffle is a must try! Great presentation! Parking around the neighborhood is pretty tough. Found it helpful to utilize Lyft to drop us off right in front of the restaurant. We ate at the bar so no long wait tonight.
author: Chi C.

description:
This place is wonderful! The butterfish carpaccio is incredible and must be enjoyed by all. I have been several times in the last two months and have enjoyed everything I've eaten.

Getting a table can be a bit tough, because the place is pretty small. I recommend heading their early. 

The service good, the food is great, the atmosphere is good
author: Mina E.

description:
We had been hearing a lot of great things about this place and decided to check it out on a random Wednesday night. It's a very small place, so the wait can be long, but we didn't mind. And it wasn't too bad after all.

Everything was great, the food far surpassed my expectations! Favorites were the hamachi sashimi with shaved truffle and the yummy pockets. Perfect date night!
author: CJ J.

description:
Hands down the best sushi in the City!  Yes it's a small place.  Yes it may be hard to get in.  Yes they should make sure the open/close times on Yelp are correct (they open at 6:00).  But after all of that, it's totally worth it.  My husband and I eat a lot of sushi.  We have our go to (cheaper) sushi place we frequent regularly, but Elephant Sushi is our special occasion sushi place.  Tip #1: They take reservations for the first seating, but you have to call when they're open to make a reservation.  They aren't on OpenTable and you can't leave a message.  Get there when they open the doors and you won't have to wait.  Also they will not seat you unless your whole party is there.  I totally understand this policy.  It's a small place and they need to turn the tables.  They can't have someone sitting there not ordering because they are waiting for the rest of their party.  So plan ahead.  Tip #2: Take public transit or a cab, parking is tough in that neighborhood.  Enough logistics, on to the food.

Flaming Sea Bass.  AMAZING!  Himalayan Trout on salt slab.  DELICIOUS!  Walu with shaved truffle.  INCREDIBLE!  The Whiteout.  YUM!  Everything we've had there has been fantastic.

On top of that the place has a cool vibe and the service is great.  I can't say enough about this place.  It's not to be missed.
author: Jennifer C.

description: By far my favorite sushi spot ever. Try the hamachi with the truffle oil it's my favorite. The wait is super long but it's worth it. If you can work your timing out right you'll have a better time. The space is super small to and gets loud so expect to go with a small party and not to try and have too intimate of an experience. If you can deal with that stuff, it's the best ever.
author: Brandon L.

description:
This place has some of the best rolls, sashimi and Nigri i have tried. The staff is very friendly and the chef is very welcoming and polite.
Great location, great food and great service!
I suggest folks here who are giving it one star should consider going again and trying the food
author: Sam S.

description:
I'll keep this one short and sweet--went in with very lofty expectations and Elephant Sushi delivered. Very fresh fish and truly inventive dishes.

My girlfriend and I went for her birthday and everything was fantastic. Enjoyed the Beastie Boys, Himalayan trout, and one other roll that I can't remember off the top of my head. Everything was delicious. The cheap sake bombs were a nice touch as well.

Service was solid and made some great recommendations. Atmosphere was modern, casual, and cozy. Not overtly pricey for a sushi place either, which was an added bonus. 

In the end, it was some of the best sushi I've ever had.
author: Steve B.

description:
I think this is the old Sushi Groove spot. Anyway, it's a totally new sushi joint now.

We were there the weekend after Thanksgiving. Our original plan was to go to Zarzuela down the street before the Flamenco performance, but they were packed, so we ended up stumbling into Elephant Sushi instead...well, sushi is kind of like tapas...kinda.

When we first walked in, I thought "uh-oh, this isn't a Japo owned sushi place" and to be honest, I almost wanted to walk away, because I'm usually disappointed with non-Japo owned sushi bars. But I was with 3 other people, so I didn't want to be a nag, so we went in. The result - I was very happy to have gone in there, because the food and the service were very good and the PRICE was great. They make their own soy sauce too! And the home made pickled ginger was very good too. 

Note: If you're going to order the sashimi salad, be aware - it is quite large.
author: Aya C.

description: Absolutely incredible. It was probably the best sushi of my life. Maguro nigiri was very fresh and tasty, and the flaming sea bass was original and delicious. My favorite part of the meal had to be finishing it off with the toro nigiri, fatty and delicious cut.
author: Jack W.

description: Nisa (hostess) is amazing, so hospitable each time I come here with my parents. The food is very fresh and comes out in a timely manner, highly recommend this place if you are trying to find a good place to eat in Polk.
author: Meriem N.

description:
In town for a couple of days and flipped a coin on which sushi place to check out near our hotel.  Glad we picked this one.  

All the other reviews seem to have it covered.  

Very cool presentation AND flavor on the Flaming Sea Bass roll.

Another roll we got (don't remember the name) had white fish, avocado, lime juice, among other things and reminded me a little of a fish taco.  Interesting and delicious.

Very friendly staff, made us feel welcome, and well taken care of.
author: Doug F.

description: Pretty disappointed that they don't follow their hours posted on website. Visiting from out of town and had heard so many good things. Walked in to get a table and the hostess said we are closed. I told her about the posted hours on the website so I was confused. She said, well we close when we want. Good to know if I come back to SF, I won't be wasting my time with that place. Sad since I had heard good things.
author: Barbara G.

description: Best sushi I've ever had. There is always a line out the door, but it is worth the wait. The white out is unreal, and I also enjoy the flaming seabass, ya man, hamachi truffle, and himalyan trout. The ambiance is nice as it is very small and the music helps set the mood. The service is always very attentive. I've never disappointed.
author: Emily T.

description:
Loved it!
Fresh Sasimi and Sushi plates.

I didn't do the fire show menu but it looked really fun.
Make sure to put on a reservation!
author: Uikwon L.

description: Favorite sushi place in SF! Our go-to orders are: chips & dip, flaming seabass, spicy habachi, ya man, spicy tuna, and white out. Love that they have pitchers of Sapporo too. Super fresh sushi with a cozy vibe. The wait is always long but it's worth it!
author: Jillian P.

description: One of my favorite sushi places in San Francisco. The roll I get every time I come in, is the flaming sea bass. It's unique, warm, melt-in-your-mouth, and as the name suggests--its on fire. My suggestion is eat earlier in the afternoon if your don't want to wait. Otherwise expect this place to get more crowded as the evening carries on.
author: Alex F.

description:
Atmosphere: On the smallish side, with only a select number of tables. Try to snag a window seat :)

F&B: The house-made ginger is killer good. I would go back just for that. The quality of the fish is really high, and the rolls are delicious, yet creative. If you're feeling adventurous, I'd recommend that scallop roll (they light this baby on fire and deliver it flaming to your table). Totally novel and yummy.

Service: Great--a tad on the slower side, but overall, nothing to complain about!

Location: Situated in quaint Russian Hill, Elephant Sushi is right up the street from Luella. If you're waiting for a reservation, or put your name down and need to kill 30-40 minutes before your name is called, pop into Luella for a cocktail at the bar. You won't be disappointed.

**Make a reservation--this tiny venue fills up quickly and wait time can be up to an hour.
author: Phoebe P.

description:
My husband and I decided to go to Sushi Groove for dinner last night. I called to see if they could take us and found out that the restaurant had changed ownership.  We thought we'd give it a try, apparently during their soft opening.  An ordinary sushi restaurant was transformed into fine dining!!!  

This is a family owned and operated restaurant and it shows.  We were greeted with warmth by both the chef and his wife.  They told us their liquor license hadn't been approved yet so they're not charging corkage or you can bring your own beer or whatever you choose. This didn't bother me as I don't drink at all. 

Now for the food!!!  We were treated to a tasting of Hamachi Truffle which was so divine that we HAD to have a full order.  Then on to the Sunomono Salad of salted cucumber & seaweed with a Japanese citrus sauce...perfection!!  My husband ordered Sizzling Mango Seabass which actually cooked at the table, then a roll, the name of which I can't remember or even describe but was delicious.  I did order an Unagi Temaki which wasn't on the menu and ended with Double Albacore - white tuna inside and out, avocado, honey mustard, toasted sesame aioli & sweet teriyaki sauce...out of this world!!!  They also make their own soy sauce and pickled ginger.

I'm actually craving more of this amazing food while writing about it :) and can't wait to see their full menu if this is as they say, a small menu. 

RUN, don't walk, to this gem of a restaurant on Russian Hill.
author: anne l.

description:
Delicious sushi and cheap drinks - what's not to love.

I came here with 2 friends and the hostess was very sweet. We put our names down and were told to expect a 45 minute wait, but were called and seated within 20 minutes. The place is pretty small, so reservations are recommended.

Our table had the sea bass roll, white-out, and the red and yellow. All were delicious, but my favorite had to be the sea bass roll - came on a bed of flames, was so satisfying, and was much richer than traditional sushi (which was what I was going for when ordering the sea bass roll!). We also got the Hello Kitty martinis, which had lychee and were $5 each -- enough said.

This is not a traditional sushi place, very Americanized, but still fresh and good fish!
author: Genevieve A.

description: Most creative sushi I have had in along time, maybe ever.  Very friendly staff, but the place is small, and I fear with more high ratings it will get very hard to find a spot on a busy night.  The food quality rocks, and the interior is super cute.
author: Guillermo E.

description: What a fantastic dining experience! Arrived about 20 minutes prior to opening time and we were luckily the second party to arrive and be seated. The line grew instantaneously, so I would definitely recommend arriving early if you haven't got a reservation, especially if you plan on grabbing Saturday night dinner as we did. Awesome modern and rustic atmosphere, cozy but not crowded, and excellent service. For the quality of the food, the pricing was extremely fair. Well worth the wait and the money. We ordered the Himalayan Trout, Beastie Boys, Hamachi Truffle, Omakaze Platter, Flaming Seabass, and some drinks. (Happy hour = $2 sake bombs and $5 Hello Kitty martini!) Everything was spectacular, being a frequent visitor to Japan and countless sushi spots, it's rare to find a restaraunt that I can truly rave about. Fresh, buttery fish with perfectly subtle flavor and excellent presentation. Our waitress was sweet, precise, and checked in frequently, and the hostess was an angel as well. My boyfriend's favorite was the Seabass sashimi with spicy yuzu ponzu that was part of the omakase, mine was the hamachi truffle. Do your tastebuds a favor and check this place out.
author: Nancy M.

description: My favorite sushi place EVER! IT doesn't get better than a flaming seabass roll from Elephant Sushi. No reservations, but there are plenty of places to grab a drink nearby while you wait.
author: Elena F.

description: This sushi place is cute and cozy and the sushi is spectacular! The dishes are inventive and all of the ingredients are fresh and super tasty. Definitely my favorite in the city. Make sure to order the sashimi on a slab of Himalayan salt... it is out of this world delicious.
author: Lauren F.

description: This is one of my favorite sushi places! I got the Godzilla roll and the flaming sea bass both were amazing. Washed it down with a couple bottles of sake. The place it's self is a little small but the food and staff makes up for that. The food came out rather quickly which was nice. I would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a great place to get some sushi!
author: Mike S.

description: My boyfriend and I dined here a month ago. Luckily we came right when they opened so no wait. The butterfish truffle and hamachi truffle was delicious. I would definitely come back!
author: A L.

description: I had high hopes of this place from all the hype and reviews just find out that it's just over priced farmed fish. I was looking for something more exceptional  with wild and/or exotic fish. Not to mention they ran out what I came for, which was their special called Beastie Boys. Oh well, time to move on to my next sushi endeavor.
author: tai t.

description:
waited an hour. got seated. ate. left.

nothing was memorable. except the wait in the nonexistent waiting room. There is literally like 1 foot of space after the door opens that people can stand in to wait. which is stupid since there is always a wait. 

the flaming sea bass was so cool since it did have a cool presentation, it came out and there was actual fire. 

the sashimi was ok. definitely not the best ive had (im a bit of a sushi snob) but come on' if youre gona be in this neighborhood and charge these prices; I'd like the highest quality and freshest fish. 

needless to say, I probably wont be back.
author: Lisa N.

description: Elephant Sushi Is around the corner, and its definitely become a go to.  Their sushi is great, and they even have an off the menu "Green Machine:" roll for my vegan girlfriend that is actually quite good! Sometimes I don't even get seafood its so good : D They also have $2 sake bombs, which I think deserves mention
author: Scott W.

description: Well its been well over a year since i last came here. Last time my friends convinced me to eat elsewhere due to wait. That was a serious mistake. Lovin it just as much as the first time.
author: Anthony L.

description: This small restaurant is like a hole in the wall... I was going to be in town visiting a friend of mine and she wanted to take me to this yummy sushi place... My friend tried making reservation 2 days before but they weren't taking anymore reservation. We both decided to just go early and wait to see if we can get seated and I guess we were lucky because we got in. The food was deeelicious and super yummy. The $2 sake bomb was also very yummy. I would love to go back when I'm back in the neighborhood.
author: Linda L.

description: Nice intimate atmosphere, though a little cramped.  Sushi was quite unique and very delicious.  I really enjoyed the flaming seabass, they serve it in a foil over fire.  Had 5 rolls, shared with another person, 2 drinks and the bill was in the low 100's, kind of pricey but it was worth the experience.  Wait was around 20 minutes on a saturday night so it wasn't bad.  Will come back, though the parking situation is annoying in this neighborhood.
author: Margarita T.

description: They should change their hours to read: perhaps 5:30- ish to maybe 10:30-ish or even more to the point: "We don't even know when we'll be open". Trendy place with sushi that is very one dimensional. Not a lot of complex or interesting flavors
author: Lee P.

description: Went here for a spontaneous date night on a Wednesday. We got the chips and dip, a tuna with pita chips appetizer, which was totally worth the $11. Then we ordered 2 rolls, the double hamachi and flaming seabass (their signature roll), which was super super delicious. We made the mistake of ordering another roll, one with spicy scallop and crab (the name escapes me), and it tasted bland, overly peppered, and pretty bad. The waitress was gracious enough to let us change our order to a different roll that tasted much better. Of course, the highlight of this whole experience were the $2 sake bombs, of which my boyfriend and I managed to drink 9 total. The only negatives I can think of are that they might be slightly understaffed and it took us some time to get the waitress's attention on multiple occasions, and the temperature was either really warm (thanks to their flaming seabass roll that grills on your table) or super cold when they open the door. We would totally come back though and I highly recommend this place.
author: Karen T.

description: I thought the service was amazing, from the check-in (wait times will be 2+ hours, be prepared) to the friendliness or the wait staff and the knowledge of the menu. The nigiri and sashimi were the best I've had in SF.
author: Sam S.

description:
Thank you Yelp 

Was visiting my daughter and she was craving Sushi.  While we had a 30 minute wait not bad for  Friday night, we were perfectly comfortable listening to great tunes and drinking wine next door (Bacchus).  The maitre de gave us a ring on my cell and we were off to a wonderful meal.

We went with the sushi assortment ,the butterfish was a pleasant surprise, and the BBQ Eel.

The banana ice cream was a perfect close and enough to share.

We'll be back
author: Ric M.

description: There is good sushi, great sushi, and Elephant Sushi. This place is incredible and quite possibly the best sushi restaurant that I've been to outside of Japan. The flavors that they mix together in their exciting variety of rolls are amazing and leave you satisfied but not stuffed. It is a small place though so be prepared for a wait - you won't regret waiting though.
author: Adam S.

description: This place has amazingly fresh and delicious sushi. Seriously, my parents and I have never had such good quality fish. I highly highly recommend the truffle hamachi and white roll. The sashimi was also amazing. The albacore melts in your mouth. Every time my parents visit, this is a must.
author: Joy S.

description: Went to Elephant sushi on the recommendation of a friend on a Sunday evening for dinner.  We called ahead and headed over, waited 5 minutes and were seated.  Food was excellent, service was also great - chefs and waiters are all friendly and engaging.  The sushi itself was some of the best I've ever had.  It was not only high quality, but it was also creative (in the best way).  Also extremely reasonably priced.
author: Alex O.

description: Best sushi in San Francisco hands down. Get there before it opens if you want to secure your table or out your name down as early as possible. This place never disappoints! Their house made ginger is the best!
author: Faiz H.

description:
Finally found a great sushi spot in the city! Points for freshness, friendly waiters, homemade ginger (makes such a difference!), and the truffle hamachi taste from the kitchen they brought out before our meal :D

My favorite rolls: white out (hamachi) & red & yellow (mango & tuna). Sapporo by the pitcher? Yes please.
author: Marina A.

description:
Good fresh sashimi.  Clean sushi bar and counter.  HOMEMADE PICKLED GINGER AND HOMEMADE SOY SAUCE!

Chef Tom Tamir seems to take pride in what he serves by telling you when to eat it and how to eat it.  He served me their most popular item as part of his Nigiri Omakase:  The Beastie Boys which is Gunkan-maki (battleship roll) with uni (sea urchin) quail egg, and ankimo (foie gras of the sea).  Chef Tom told me to eat it first and in 1 bite, so I did and it was delcious, it melted in my mouth.  All their other nigiri tasted good and fresh as well.

ELEPHANT SUSHI IS DEFINATELY A MUST TRY.
author: Rudi A.

description: My boyfriend and I have been on the hunt for the best sushi in SF - and we finally found it! We live around the corner and had been turned off by the often long lines outside of Elephant Sushi, but tonight we swung by and we couldn't be happier with the decision. The sushi was unique and absolutely delicious - it literally illuminated our palettes. From the Walu Carpaccio sashimi (w/truffles!!) to the Flaming Sea Bass - it was such a treat and we will definitely be back.
author: Roya S.

description: Weird hours and a crazy long line, but this place is worth the wait! This is the best sushi I have ever had. The fish was so fresh and flavorful.  The flaming seabass was like nothing I have ever had before. I could eat it everyday! The only downside is that they have ruined sushi for me. No other place has been able to compare.
author: Angelee S.

description: This place was great and we are happy it was our final dining spot in SF. The sashimi portions were really generous. We had the toro and the hamachi truffle, both dishes were delicious. We also had the Beastie Boys, unagi, flaming seabass, and uni. All were great. I am a fan of sashimi, so the flaming seabass was a great cooked alternative. I drank the HELLO KITTY martini and it was really tasty. Place is super packed as it is tiny, but it was worth the wait for us.
author: Aline D.

description:
Just came to Elephant Sushi for the first time, and I have to say it is the best sushi I have ever had. The fish was incredibly fresh and so delicious. Highly recommend the Godzilla and Double Albacore Roll if you like tuna! The hostess and our waiter were also both very friendly, accommodating, and helpful. 

Oh, and $5 martinis and $2 sake bombs.
author: Meg W.

description: It is definitely a small restaurant so be prepared to wait for a table. However, they were very accommodating when we did arrive and both the hostess, our server and the sushi chefs (we sat at the bar) were very attentive. There is a good selection of appetizers, side dishes and the rolls are quite unique. But what I would love to see is a bit more roll and nigri options as well as more dessert options (they only had 1 and it was ice cream). This is not the kind of place you to to get a stereotypical California roll but to try some neat combinations which was fun for us. Everything was very good but I can't say I was blown away. However, if I was in the area and looking for a sushi spot I'd return.
author: Regina S.

description: Good sushi. Unfortunately horrible customer service. The hostess is terribly unfriendly which makes the wait that would be worth it for the food, definitely not worth it. We were told a wait of 30-45 minutes. An hour later she said it would be another 30-45 with an air of annoyance that we'd even asked.
author: Allison R.

description:
I had dinner with a friend here spontaneously the other night. We were looking for something in the neighborhood and had heard good things about Elephant.  It is located in the old Sushi Groove space (which I was never a fan of). They have redone the space, it looks great and has a very quaint and approachable vibe. It is also apparently owned by completely new people, although I thought the hostess looked familiar.

Upon our entrance we were greeted and sat quickly. The service overall was pretty good. They forgot our wine, which was a bit of a bummer, but quickly brought it once reminded (big pours btw way too!).

The sushi was delish, they have an amazing fire seabass roll that is literally served in flames at the table.  The other standard rolls were great too. The cucumber salad was pretty tiny and not as exciting as I had expected, but it's a pretty simple dish anyway.

I'll definitely be back to Elephant. It's convenient, reasonably priced and very fresh sushi. 

M
author: Melissa H.

description:
To all the Mr. Marina contestants coming here to get your California Rolls, please save yourself the trouble of walking up the hill and hit one of the ten other places within a 2-3 block radius that will have all the California rolls you can eat.

This is a sushi bistro with a small menu of house specialties. It is simply awesome. The servers are gracious. The rolls are inventive and fresh. The prices are pretty average for San Francisco. What more could you want? 

Every neighborhood in this city has 3-4 decent sushi joints within easy walking distance. This one is the rare one that is "special occasion" nice, while still remaining "once or twice a month" affordable. 

For the everyday, miso soup crowd, yes, it's not your gig. There are 3-4 places within stumbling distance to take care of you, though,  so stop bitching. This place is rad.
author: Dallas B.

description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco. It's the kind of place where everything on the menu looks terrific and you keep ordering roll after roll after roll until you are in physical pain and can eat no more.
author: Gregory S.

description: Possibly the best sushi I have ever had. The tuna and salmon melt in your mouth, the rolls are flavorful but not overwhelming. A little on the pricey side but definitely worth it. The wine is expensive but the beer is reasonable, great sake selection and sake bombs are $2 during happy hour. Seating is limited so make a reservation or get there early (they open at 6). Highly recommended. Try the double albacore and ya man rolls.
author: Sarah F.

description: Me and my boy went to have our Valentine's dinner and everything from the food to the hostess was on point like no other. We had the flaming sea bass, white dragon and another roll we can't remember. All of them were amazing and we shared a delicious Lychee Martini. When we come back, we will definitely come here without a second thought.
author: Andrae V.

description: It's a fantastic space. The hostess was extremely friendly and accommodating. The quality of the rolls was fantastic! We had the Godzilla, White Dragon, Boom Box (wrapped in a banana, which is unique and very tasty), Flaming Seabass (highly recommended), and Hamachi (yellowtail) sashimi. The pickled ginger with the sushi is a terrific touch.
author: Alex C.

description: Heard wonderful things from friends and co-workers. Was very excited to finally get some good sushi. I spent my money and time to get to this restaurant (an hour before they closed - according to their website) and upon walking up to a full restaurant, with a projected sign and open doors, I was told they were closed. The sushi chef was still preparing rolls in the back. When I asked how and about the hours on their website, I was told they "were incorrect hours" and that "we close when we want". I would have been more accepting of numerous other explanations, but not "we close when we want". Please change your hours online to "open when we want - close when we want". Then I would not be surprised. 3 customer service oriented customers have now turned to detractors of this business. Word of mouth spreads.
author: Dana D.

description: There are so many sushi places in San Francisco, but this one impressed beyond what I would have expected.  Their use of olive oil mixed with sushi was one of the more unique things that I've tasted in my travels of over 30 countries.  They had a diverse selection of types of sushi, so this could be a good place for people who are both adventurous and people who aren't.  I would absolutely recommend- and I really like the people who work here.
author: Charles C.

description: Your sushi is amazing, I was there last night on valentines day, had the best time of our lives. Great customer service! Highly recommended!! YOUR SUSHI IS GREAT!
author: Cassandra C.

description: Clunky, tasteless, poorly executed sushi. This is a great place to get drunk. This is not a great place to get sushi. Basically, they have cheap sake bombs (as the bro's behind us noisily kept slamming, chopsticks flying...) but the sushi looked like it was made by a child.  So if you're looking to get wasted, go ahead. If you're looking for good sushi, don't bother.
author: tracey m.

description: I finally made it over here after meeting the owner a while back.  I arrived just as the restaurant was opening & got a seat at the sushi bar.  I glanced over my shoulder a couple of minutes later & the place was full.  & with good reason.  The fish was super fresh & tasty, the flavors always balanced & complimentary.  Miken took excellent care of me & offered spot-on suggestions for my meal.  Tamir & his team have a good thing happening here & I can't wait to get back.  If you're into supporting small, local businesses run by proprietors who care, Elephant Sushi is your place.
author: Jason C.

description:
Ate here with family of five.  Had the rainbow roll,flaming sea bass and a salmon avocado roll.  

Very distinctive atmosphere with reggae playing in background.  The music was Jamaican, but the ambiance was Japanese fusion.  The flaming sea roll is quite a production- it is served flaming at your table - well constructed dish if a little hearty.  

The hamachi appetizer was probably the best I've had.  

Despite large size of our party, service was very friendly and attentive. 

We WILL return on our next trip here.
author: Carl S.

description: Nope. Not good. Gimmicks win out over quality cut fish and well prepared rice. Not worth the hassle anymore
author: Michael B.

description: Incredibly good. Novel sushi plates. Not your typical sushi. Very fresh. Get here early as the place fills up fast
author: Christian D.

description: Told 30 min wait. After waiting an hour they have just said it will be another 40 mins. Fed up. Never going back as this has happened too many times now
author: Sarah C.

description: I came here and love their lion king roll and Godzilla roll. One of the best sushi restaurant I've been to.
author: Krystal S.

description: Sushi in SF! Highlights - Great service, very sheik, reggae beats.  However after a 90 min wait, I was really hoping for a whole lot more in the food dept. Started with the Godzilla which was quite good. Shifted gears to the sashimi / farmers market salad - also good. Last course was the omokase sashimi. Bluefin, yellowtail, salmon, butterfish, scallops, and I believe a tricked up snapper. Of the selections the butterfish was really good (lemony flavor and awesome texture) but everything else was unassuming. Solid night of sushi but left hoping for more.
author: Eddie R.

description: Great place for sushi if you a) are lucky enough to get there when a table is available, and b) aren't starving when there are no tables available. It can get packed FAST. The last 2 times we've tried to come for dinner, there has been a 45-60 minute wait. We were too hungry both times to wait, and since it's a small place, the only real place to wait is outside.  If you can snag a table though, their sushi is delicious!!
author: Sheena C.

description:
Really great sushi! New to the city and this just set the sushi bar very high! My girlfriend and I started w the tasty pockets (tofu skin with rice and spicy bay scallops) and I Highly recommend it. We then got the white out roll (topped w butter fish) WOW! So good I already can't wait to have it again. We only ordered that particular roll because of the sample of the butter fish sashimi they gave us when we sat down. Also tried the flaming sea bass and the red and yellow roll. Both were great. 

No complaints about the service and the sushi came out quick but not too quick.

If you like sushi you have to try this place!
author: Valerie F.

description: The place is tiny. We had reservations for an early dinner and there was no wait. I loved everything we ordered except the Godzilla. The tuna wrapping the roll was too thick for my taste.
author: Tina D.

description: Went to Elephant Sushi for the first time from a recommendation from a friend and was  totally impressed. It's located in a great area (quieter side of the Polk St. bar scene but only a walking distance from it)  and they served up some seriously creative rolls with large pieces and generous cuts of fish. My favorite roll was the Ya Man roll--such great taste and textures. I would definitely eat here again! Come on the earlier side of the evening to avoid a wait or make a reservation for the opening slots.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
This new sushi spot on Hyde is a must go to!

Really good sushi, fun vibe and great music.  Customer service is amazing as well.  Their rolls are really fresh and reasonable priced.  They put fruit on some of their rolls, which sounds foul, but when you go in to it with an open mind you will be pleasantly surprised!  

Great for a Friday night dinner before a night on the town but make sure to make a reservation, people are starting to catch on and you may not get a table if you walk in since its such a small spot.

Try to the chips and dip for an app!
author: Bobbi R.

description:
Best sushi I've had in my life. The whiteout roll is just flat out amazing. 

Unfortunately, their hours are very restricted and they don't actually operate according to the hours on Yelp. Out of the 7 times I've attempted to eat here, I've only been successful 2 times - they either close early, run out of fish early, don't open on time, etc. Of course, the fact I still keep trying to eat here is a testament to how good the sushi is.
author: TS S.

description:
Big win coming here. Charming hostess, adorable waitress, friendly chef, very good food. Everything is a little on the pricy side except the drinks, but that didn't stop us. 

* House pickled ginger and house made soy sauce: Not just pretense. Really good products that taste different, subtler, than your regular variety. 
* Truffle Hamachi: Lives up to the hype. Great aroma, good balance, crunchy garlic. 
* Naked Scallop Roll: Fresh creamy scallops, spicy masago, nutty finish. 
* Beastie boys: Wonderful union of raw quail egg, uni, and ankimo. The shiso leaf provides a pleasant herbal quality while chewing. 
* Uni nigiri: wanted a little more uni, we were not disappointed. 
* Basil Salmon nigiri: Not usually a fusion fan, but this worked for me. 
* Hamachi scallion roll: a little too dense, but good fish and flavor. 
* White out: Brûléed butterfish on top gives a smoky finish to this meaty and satisfying roll. 
* Spicy hamachi: Surprisingly citrusy and refreshing. Not the usual mashed fish + hot sauce. 
* Scallop nigiri: They sneak a little wasabi and yuzu in there. You will enjoy it. 

So yeah, we tried some food. We liked everything they put in front of us. We will be back.

Condescending side note: check out the 1-star reviews for this place and you'll find some baffled Yelpers wondering why there isn't a California roll or Unagi here. They are correct that Elephant is not traditional. It's an innovative sushi bistro. At the same time, the tightly packed rice balls of canned crab these reviewers are looking for so they can dunk them in soy sauce and wasabi, are not traditional either. Neither is the bought-in, precooked eel, smothered in sugar sauce so unfortunately ubiquitous on sushi menus. If you have a place to go for those (like, say, Safeway) then I encourage you to go there instead. This place is for all people who like good food, and are looking for a break from the norm.
author: Bo J.

description:
It was okay.., nothing too special.
Our sever was a bit clueless when we asked her questions, not sure if she's new? Or if she just didn't hear what I said. I've had better!
author: M. L.

description:
Unlike many other people here, my issue with this place was not about their refusal to serve california roll.  I actually thought the sushi was fantastic, and some of the best I've ever had- and I'm a huge sushi enthusiast!

I gave it five stars for the good food, but only one thing ticked me off--our waitress.  She was very rude, kind of acting like she didn't really work there and was just filling in for a friend, so everything she did was some massive favor.  At one point we called for her to bring us more water because we had run out, and she looked at us and gave us this sarcastic glance, as though to say, "Really?! Water?!"  Yes, seriously, you're a waittress and waittresses bring water.  Not a hard concept to grasp.  However I don't believe her attitude deserves the removal of a star, because 1.) it might have just been a bad day for her and 2.) the hostess was lovely, so she kind of canceled the waitress out.
author: Alexandra B.
