description: Amazing sushi, complex and unique flavor combinations. Their menu selection and food presentation is art for food-lovers. The restaurant itself is quaint and intimate, with great character and charm.
author: Gaya G.

description: First of all, they don't serve miso soup. Secondly, their home-made pickled ginger and lite soy were disappointing. This is probably one of the worst sushi places I have been to in a long time and I eat sushi at least twice a week. Im not giving this place 1 star based on the ginger and soy, im giving it because the fish quality and roll selection were not good. Not sure how this restaurant made it to Russian Hill especially since Okoze Sushi is right around the corner and is legions above this place.
author: Mr. P.

description: Amazing!  One of my new favorite sushi spots in SF.  The sashimi and tataki is fantastic.
author: Allan G.

description: This is probably the best sushi restaurant I have ever been to in my life, and I eat a lot of sushi. The flavors are absolutely mind-blowing (the carpaccio is TO DIE FOR) and everything is extraordinarily unique and special... Not your run of the mill sushi spot. They only take 2 reservations nightly, and there will definitely be a wait if you go on a weekend night... But this place is COMPLETELY worth waiting for. YUM YUM YUM.
author: Ella A.

description:
Eh.....

My friend and I decided on an impromptu dinner, and since I was feeling super lazy I didn't want to stumble too far from my house. We landed on Elephant Sushi, as I had only been once when they had just opened. I arrived around 8pm without a reservation, and was expecting about a 45min wait. Almost an hour and a half later, we were finally seated. The place is really tiny, so I wasn't horribly upset or surprised. What was a bit unsettling was the pair of girls who arrived about 10 min before us, and got seated at the same time....although I know that wasn't the restaurant's fault...but rather the universe confirming my sense of poor timing. The girls were seated directly next to us, and were immediately brought a complimentary appetizer. We stared at them with sad faces for about 10 minutes until we finally received ours. We then ordered beers, which were served without glasses -- and let me just say...I'm a beer girl. I can drink it out of anything. But when I'm at a nice restaurant and have been dreaming about this beer for the past 90 minutes, can a girl just get a glass like the rest of the restaurant? Our waiter finally took our order, but not before he took the girls' next to us. He seemed annoyed by us (even though we had been nothing but nice) and way more into the girls at the next table. I mean, they were cute, I get it.....but I'm starving and at this point I really felt like I had worked for my meal. Aside from the service, the food was great. The roll with the banana is definitely my favorite, and the homemade pickled ginger was so good I basically turned it into my entree. My advice...make a reservation well in advance, or spend the wait time at the little wine bar on the corner.
author: Courtney K.

description: This is an interesting place. Walking in for the first time, I was impressed by the ability of the waitstaff to assiduously avoid making eye contact or acknowledge my presence in any way for an extended period of time. With that said, once I waited it out the food and service was very good. As per the other reviews, cheap sake bombs, house made ginger, good rolls all at a pretty reasonable cost are a winning combination.
author: Michael B.

description:
I wouldn't wait more than 20 minutes for a table here. As it happens, they allow reservations only for 6:00 and we went last minute that day. While we were there (Saturday night), I should note that people seemed to be seated within 20 minutes, but I don't know if that's a fluke or not.

I had heard outstanding reviews of this place and was eager to try it out after my bad experience at Tamashi on Union Street. We were greeted with a sample of their butterfish sashimi which was outstanding! I was also happy to see a whole jar of ginger brought out to us since my boyfriend and I love ginger, but immediately wondered if they bothered to change  and wash out the jars since I noticed people using their chopsticks to get ginger out instead of the tongs that it came with. Luckily, the waitress said that they change the ginger. I realize now I should have asked if they wash the jars in between!

We ordered a few rolls and nigiri. The bottom line is that the more "fancy" they try to get, the worse the roll was. But let's start with the basics: rice. The first order that came out was our eel nigiri. It was beautifully presented with the long eel folded back upon itself and the flavor of the eel was delicious, but it was unwieldy. The piece was too long to carry on chopsticks and to make matters worse, the rice fell apart! Not just with this piece, but with later orders. Rice should be a rudimentary skill for master sushi makers and our rice was falling all over the place. Minus a star!

The best of the evening was the "White Out" roll which had an incredible balance of flavors. We had another roll with that that I don't recall other than it was ok. After that, we had one more special which featured tuna and mango. We were told it would be mildly spicy, but it was not AT ALL. I'm not one for very spicy so that was ok. I LOVE mango, but in this instance, it completely overpowered the fish, which I don't like 1) because I love the flavor of fresh, raw fish and if we're paying for it, I want to taste it and 2) it makes me wonder why the chef would choose to cover the flavor of the fish... was it going bad? That said, it was a delicious mango dish, not a delicious sushi dish.

I constantly saw the flaming roll again going out to almost every other table. What is it with these flaming rolls? It's already been admitted to me by servers that they're just for show so why order it? To each their own though. 

I like the idea of interesting combinations - crispy garlic with sushi is delicious. Olive oil overpowers it. WAY too heavy. However, I still prefer to taste the flavor of the fish above all else. Sushi isn't cheap so why cover up what we pay for? I think these guys should keep it simple or stay along the lines of what they accomplished with the White Out roll.
author: Maria Y.

description: Not impressed. Perhaps this is a good gaijin roll place, but that's not what I wanted. I was hoping to sit at the bar and get some decent nigiri sushi and sashimi. Made reservations and our seats at the bar were waiting for us. We sat down, ordered sake and told the waitress that we'd order from the chef. The waitress replied, "The chef prefers that you order from the waitstaff."  Um.. What?  "OK", I replied, "Just bring us the bill for our sake and we'll be on our way". This seemed to shock the waitress and chef, so the chef agreed to serve us at the bar. I asked the Chef, "What's the point of having a bar if you're not going to interact with your customers". Bizarre. I almost asked the chef if he even trained in a sushi bar. But whatever... The fish was ok. The rice in the nigiri was pretty good. We won't be coming back.
author: Da Wei S.

description:
We went to Elephant Sushi after seeing all the rave reviews this place just had. What a disappointment!

If your idea of a sushi restaurant is to go to a "look at how hip we are" place blasting loud hip hop in your ears while trying to order any basic sushi plate, hearing only "oh sorry, we don't do this kind of sushi here. But look at our other overpriced items, don't they have COOL names like BEASTIE BOYS ROLLS!" 

Then yes, that would be the place for you.

Really? No California rolls? No miso soup? Oh right, they're trying to be "different."

Every plate we tried tasted blend. The fish was clearly not fresh. All the time I was thinking to myself "How can you mess up sushi?" 

This is very frustrating for a not-so-cheap restaurant.

Save yourself your money and go to a more authentic sushi place in the Tenderloin.
author: Francois C.

description: #1 sushi spot in sf. i LOVE this spot - def a local fav.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Great sushi. Horrible service. They told us the wait was thirty minutes and an hour we were not seated. At that point, they also told us we couldn't sit together as a group after telling us we could. The manger was very rude.
author: Amanda H.

description: Small place but great sushi - fresh, delicious, staff is very attentive. I sat at the bar and watched the chefs at work. Recommend for sure!
author: Milena T.

description: Beautiful sushi AND delicious. Try the chips N dip and the Ya Man sushi.  Mmm. I'm sad it's over.
author: Megan A.

description: Great service, delicious food, little restaurant with good atmosphere, you should try it! Cons: wine overpriced.
author: Alice D.

description: I would go back. It was good...not great, but good. Better than most places that people in SF claim are "great". I give a thumbs up for the creativity. We were lucky and got a same day reservation on a Saturday. Server was a 3 out 5...didn't know much about the fish nor the sake,but she did her job good. Lots of "different" kinds of rolls which was kewl....fish was good. Its not my go to "i gotta have it" spot but I would go back. Great spot for people that are new to sushi.
author: Baron C.

description: Great little sushi restaurant! We really enjoyed the jalepeno sashimi, nigiri, and flaming sea bass roll. Everything we ordered was fresh and very good!
author: Dani O.

description: The sushi was excellent.  Rolls were brought out as prepared.  It was nice to have a continual flow of different rolls to the table.  The service was good for an extremely pack, very small restaurant. The only down side was the check in process.  The hostess was a little scattered.  She told us it would be a 45 min to an hour wait and took our cell number to call us when the table was ready.  As it was chilly and windy out and there was no room to wait inside, we walked down the block to have a drink while we waited. The hostess called with in 15 minutes and unfortunately my husband didn't answer right away.  Seeing the missed call, we rushed back to find out our table had been given away.  This time, west rod by the door in the wind and cold and were seated within 15 minutes.  TIP:  do not leave the outside of the restaurant no matter how longer the wait or how windy the night!
author: Joy M.

description: As a vanilla sushi eater, I was a bit nervous at first about coming here. But they definitely had enough options for me. The service was very good, but it's just very cramped-feeling in there.
author: Philip H.

description: Hands down best sushi spot in the city... And I'm super picky about sushi.  It's a hidden gem!
author: Kate S.

description: I was so excited about this place, but am bummed it ended on such a bad note. I was at the sushi bar for exactly 1 hour and as soon as I finished my second glass of wine  (i was about to leave, but finishing the paragraph of my book), And after spending over $100 for just one person,the hostess asked me to leave because people were waiting. When is 1 hour too long to take a single seat?
author: Siobhan Q.

description: This place is fantastic. The fish is super fresh. The combinations are so unique. I'm visiting from out of town and next time I'm in San Francisco I'll definitely be back. The beastie boys is definitely something to try if it's your first time. My girlfriend really liked the Hello Kitty Martini.
author: Kyle T.

description: This place is just... Awesome.  Food you won't taste anywhere else - and I've done French Laundry!
author: Josel S.

description: Stopped in here last night (Thursday) with my husband but there was a 40 minute wait so we decided to make a reservation in advance for tonight.  We arrived about 5 minutes early and our table was ready.  I was amazed that with such a busy/popular spot, the hostess remembered us from the night before! Anyway, we started with the chips n' dip which was fantastic.  We ordered the flaming seabass, spicy hamachi, and spicy tuna rolls.  Everything was delicious!! Definitely will return.
author: Meaghan P.

description: it's 4 stars - not 5. if you are a connoisseur, this is not what u are looking for. if you're craving sushi and want value, this place is perfect. don't bother calling to make reservations, they don't answer the phones and there's no voicemail. best to show up 30 min before open and join the line.
author: Chief G.

description:
AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST. Not only the food was terribad but they actually charged 8$ more on my credit card. I am planning to call my bank for dispute tomorrow and I am definitely not happy about how these guys charged extra for nothing. PLEASE keep your customer receipt just in case.

 Okay so where do I start? Although I've made no comments/reviews of such restaurants, I've been yelping since 2008 and it was my first time ever how 4 star restaurants in yelp have betrayed my expectation.

 There is no place to park nearby whatsoever so prepare to park 10 blocks away or take a cab. When we entered elephant sushi, we were informed that two customers have just left the bar so we can take a seat as soon as waiter/waitress cleans it. We waited about 25 minutes to take a seat, pretty much staring at an empty bar all day waiting for our assigned waitress to appear from the back room.

 We ordered assorted sashimi, salmon nigiri and double albacore roll. ALL of their food was salty to the max. I'd say their nigiri and roll was edible. But my god their sashimi was the worst piece of sushi I've ever had in my life. It was not fresh at all, marinated in a way that they've made the fish taste like a mixture of pure oil and salt. The waiter forgot to order assorted sashimi plate so we waited extra 30 minutes for this poorly flavored overpriced sashimi.

 Oh also this place does not have edamame, unagi (they don't have unagi AT ALL) toro and many others. I mean which sushi bar/restaurant does not sell unagi? UNAGI? The food is bad and overpriced, the service was terrible, they overcharged 8$ on top of my bill. If you want to ruin your date night experience, this place is just for you. If you are craving for some overpriced crappy sushi, go visit Elephant sushi
author: James K.

description: What happened to Sushi Groove?  No edamame on the menu, what.the.hell? Disappointed with this place entirely.
author: M P.

description: The Flaming Sea Bass and the Hamachi with Truffle Oil were fantastic!
author: Michael G.

description: I'm giving 3 stars not because I had a bad experience here or anything. I thought the food and service was fine, but I didn't think the sushi was that great. I would categorize this as a fun place that is trying to be different, but they are missing the mark when it comes to good sushi. Maybe I'm a purist, but I don't like my sushi rolls drenched in sauce and BBQ'd over an open flame while wrapped in foil. I ordered a couple rolls and a bunch of different nigiri. The rolls are certainly creative and that is clearly their main draw, but the nigiri was just ok. Nigiri really lays the chefs skills and ingredients bare and it showed their fish could be better and their sushi rice needs some work. I do like their house made pickled ginger and fresh wasabi. Those are nice touches.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Writing this review really pains me. First off, the service and staff was beyond friendly and attentive so 5 stars for that. The restaurant itself is cozy and inviting which made it a really pleasant place to dine. The problem is the food.

The rolls were nothing special and really overpriced for what you get.  We also ordered the famous hamachi truffle oil app which was just ok, not sure why everyone is so excited about it.

Although I commend the restaurant for trying to serve house-made/organic/local/etc ginger, the ginger itself taste horrible.

This place is way over-hyped, try other sushi places in the city instead.
author: yoni s.

description: Let me start this by saying the food is great. But, the way I was treated by your new hostess last night was ridiculous. I live across the street from this place and have come here many times for dinner with no problems at all. But last night was a different story. I went over to put my name and phone number on the waiting list per usual and came back an hour later to check where my boyfriend and I stood on the list. I pointed to my name on the list to the hostess which caused her to jumped back away from me dramatically.  Hugging her clipboard tightly to her chest, she asked me to recite my phone number to her....like I was lying to her or something to get a table sooner?? Do people do that? Anyways, later, after finally getting the call our table was ready, my boyfriend and I walked inside and headed straight for the two open spots at the bar. The hostess then ran after us and told us to wait until the table was ready. Confused, I told her that it was ready and pointed to the bar, and she said, "oh sorry I thought you wanted THAT table over there...okay you can go sit down". "Thanks".   We continue walking to take our seats at the bar and then the hostess runs towards us AGAIN and blocks my boyfriend from sitting down and tells him he has to put his name on the list first. WTF?!   I told her he is with me and she said, "oh sorry I only noticed your face"... whatever that means. I thought the torment from this crazy person was over but sadly not. As I was taking a bite of my (delicious) sushi the hostess comes up behind me and scoots in my chair like I was in HER way. Ew. This new hostess seriously needs a lesson in customer service. Please remind her that she's not a bouncer at a night club. I will be returning (on her nights off) but please tell her to RELAX.
author: Lauren E.

description: Best Sushi I've ever had...nothing like regular sushi places around..friendly servers n chefs ...a must if you are in SF n love Sushi ..
author: Vikram S.

description:
I would give this place zero stars if I could! DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU HAVE A PARTY OVER 4 PEOPLE - they would prefer to have an empty restaurant than serve you!

We came here on a Thursday night at 6pm with 6 people. We walked into a COMPLETELY empty restaurant and asked the hostess if we could have a table for 6. She looks at us and says "We don't seat parties more than 4." We looked around and pointed to a table of 4 that was next to a table of 2 and asked if she could push them together and she said "no, we don't do that." We walked out of this completely empty restaurant baffled that they would prefer to have any empty restaurant than seat 6 hungry people who would eat and drink a lot.

We walked down the street to Sushi Ozoke who happily seated us and we had a great meal. We walked back by Elephant Sushi about an hour later and the restaurant had 2 people in it and the tables we asked to be seated in were still empty!! WHAT A JOKE! I totally understand that it is a tiny restaurant but seriously? I'd rather spend my money on people who want it. 

Will never (try to) eat here again!
author: Laura W.

description: This place has the most amazing sushi! Highly recommended. In particular the flaming sea bass and the blue fin tuna sashimi.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Beastie Boys and Flaming Sea Bass. So ridiculously good it makes you wonder why you've wasted so much time with other places before coming to Elephant Sushi.  Nice atmosphere, not a lot of seating so there will be a line guaranteed. No problem though, as there are tons of other wine bars close by that you can cozy up in before dinner.
author: Linh S.

description: Great place! Had a moderately priced dinner ($51) with my girlfriend last week. So good! Their Sashimi Salad was delicious, and had a lot of sashimi in it. Their rolls were great too!
author: David N.

description: The first time I dined at Elephant Sushi I absolutely loved it; great service, friendly host, amazing food.  The second time I dined here similar experience, but the third most recent time was super disappointing.  After being seated my two friends and I order a pitcher of Sapporo and the house hot sake as well as some appetizers. After getting our drinks we waited for some time for our food, after the pitcher and sake ran out we ordered another round as well as some additional rolls, at this point we were all very hungry.  A few of the rolls came out, some forgotten, no appetizers and really no confirmation from our waitress if we would be getting them.  About 20 minutes later after all drinks and the few rolls were devoured she finally came back and checked on us, we asked about our apps and she said they were coming.  Finally another 15 or so minutes later our 2 orders of salmon sashimi and the flaming sea bass came out (which takes at least 7 minutes to cook, reasoning for why I placed the order FIRST).  Food great but again server no where to be found.  And when the bill came my three friends and I all put down our cards, but of course she could not split the bill three ways, not a big deal but I have to say after such awful service I didn't really think it was fair to all of a sudden start going by some "restaurant protocol" bs. If your are going to completely ignore a table, mess up everything we ordered and then start telling me what your policy is than maybe you should brush up on your hospitality skills.  Sadly won't be going back.
author: Brooke K.

description:
My new fav sushi spot. I've been three times and its been excellent every time. It lives up to the hype, and if you can't get a reservation, it's worth the wait. 

And their $2 sake bombs aren't bad either...
author: Serena M.

description: This place is a relatively trendy restaurant tucked away in Russian Hill. The sushi rolls are meh - not great but not bad. The most unique thing about this place is the house made ginger, which comes in a cute little mason jar and their house made soy sauce. I
author: Stephanie C.

description: Really good spot, small and you're pretty packed in but it's well worth it as the food is fresh and lots of interesting dishes to try and share. Great service, spirited sushi bar, lots happening for a small place but overall, would go back for sure.
author: Adam U.

description: I hope they keep the prices the way they are. I think it's very reasonable and delicious.  Great spot for the neighborhood.
author: Margs B.

description: Love this place.  Waits are pretty bad on the weekends. But the sushi is fresh and delicious.  Get the white out roll, Salmon Sashimi
author: Jay H.

description: Terrific sushi. Excellent initial course offered by the sushi chef who prepared my entire meal. I have eaten a lot of sushi in many cities, and this is one place I will return to, should I ever find myself in San Francisco again. Well worth the long uphill hike from my hotel near FIsherman's Wharf. The dragon roll was worth the trip in itself.
author: Steven K.

description: Not sure why the reviews are so good. The food was weird, not good at all. They were out of half the things we wanted to order & was completely unapologetic about it. The server kind of did this laugh at us actually, like too bad for you better luck next time. And the server also tried to do a bait & switch bringing us something else pretending it's what we ordered when they didn't even have it in the first place. Worst service I've ever had, that girl should just get fired. Then at the end they gave us the wrong bill. Complete incompetence. The whole experience was something I would''ve preferred to live without
author: Angela Z.

description:
Incredible sushi. The rice was fluffy and the seaweed wraps were toasty. Really fresh  nigiri. Service was a bit slow. 

EDIT: Been back 3 times now, this is by far my favorite place to eat. Service is not slow at all normally. The prices are great especially for how good it is. 
Recommendations
- uni, my favorite and the best i've had in sf so far  
- walu nigiri, they torch it for a few seconds and then put some amazing magic dust on it
- ocean trout nigiri, I'd never had it before but I thought it was better than salmon 
- tuna nigiri
- white out roll
author: Oliolioo O.

description:
Everything about this place is great.

Food = Rolls are excellent.  Anything you order is perfect and oh so unique.  Flaming seabass must have.  Himalayan trout and walu.  

Service - Great.  The hostess is a darling and sushi chef's are so friendly.

tip:  without reservations go there before 7 because it a small place.  If it's 2 people eating at bar is very enjoyable.
author: FoodieSF U.

description: This is truly as good as it gets! I signed up on yelp just to be able to do a review for this place. There wasn't one roll that we tried which wasn't out of this world. This is the place I will go back to every time I'm in the bay, and this is the place I will recommend to everyone who goes to the bay.  You're missing out big time if you don't try this out! Favorites were: Hamachi Roll, Godzilla, and Red and Yellow.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Tried out Elephant Sushi last night and thought the sushi was fantastic!  The service was great, our server and the hostess were super friendly and attentive.  Everything tasted fresh and we loved the presentation as well.  We tried the white out (really nice), the flaming seabass (super fun dish and experience) and truffle hamachi (you can't go wrong with truffle oil).  We tried a couple other rolls, had a bottle of wine and a great seat right in the window.  I could do without all the comments taped up covering the entire front door and door-side windows, but overall, the rest of the experience made us happy and we will be back.
author: Janelle C.

description: This place is amazing.  The servers are great, the staff is sooo nice.  And the food, oh my, so delish!  Get there early because this place is small, and very popular.
author: Leslie M.

description:
I've been looking for a great, fresh, sushi spot in my neighborhood and Elephant sushi is it!! My husband and I love to sit at the bar and enjoy the experience. The staff is very friendly and the sushi is sooooo tasty! 

 I recommend the Godzilla roll, flaming sea bass, and the ya man roll!
author: Chandry B.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! The owner is super cool and the food is consistently deeliciious!  Sometimes I feel guilty for not trying new spots being that I live in a city full of great restaurants but this place is a guarantee for yummy food and friendly service which is why I cant get enough!
author: Deborah D.

description:
Delicious!!! Went for the soft opening a few months back and enjoyed it immensely. Yes, the wait was long, but it was worth it - plus, we ended up getting a big table in the back. 

Loved the Jalapeño hamachi, as well as a roll with banana on it! Sounds bizarre but was actually really good. The flaming sea bass was overrated.

Sake is cheap - $2 a bomb, or bottles for affordable prices.
author: Lina L.

description: Very attentive service, fresh ingredients, love love love their house made pickled ginger & some creative items, but I'm still loyal to Okoze since they know what I like and make a point to recommend variations of preparations on my favorite things.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Never gave this place a shot for some reason. when I lived around the corner...finally tried it and whoa...this dude has is one of the most creative, "new sushi" type style chefs in SF. I wish i had never waited.
author: Grubbinator A.

description: REALLY good sushi (especially the flaming roll) and $2 sake bombs..I'm sold! Really great atmosphere here.  The only negative was that there was a very long wait on a Friday night and the hostess forgot to call us when our table was ready.  Otherwise, everything was perfect!
author: Katie G.

description: So many strange mixes of flavors and ingredients.. all were right on the money! Such a great night out with friends. Loved the play on chips and dip.
author: Kat J.

description: We enjoyed this cozy spot on Hyde Street, opting to sit at the bar with the friendly chefs cooking in front of us. The three rolls we tried were delightful, though one would hope so given that the prices are on the higher side. The beverage options are ample - a pitcher of Sapporo and large sake did just the trick and for a good price. The staff is attentive and friendly, offering recommendations upon request. We often lament sushi options in the surrounding neighborhoods, but will certainly return to Elephant again soon.
author: Corey B.

description: I just dined here with my husband for their soft-opening, and the food was delicous.  I hope that they keep the truffle hamachi appetizer on the regular menu because I would order it every time.  The owner Tom came by to introduce himself and was very friendly and open to feedback.  The service was excellent as well, especially for a soft opening.  I believe Elephant Sushi is in the old Sushi Groove space.
author: Katherine M.

description:
Holy hell.  Five stars!  

I don't think SF is particularly known for its sushi, so I wasn't expecting much when my friend suggested we get dinner at Elephant Sushi on a Friday night.  We got there early enough where there was no line, and were able to sit at the counter immediately.  

The sushi was BOMB.  Crazy delicious.  Fresh, innovative (I'm looking at you tempura wrapped in tuna with some kind of sriracha sauce) and just ... insanely delicious.  

They do rolls, sashimi, and some hot and cold appetizers.  We ordered three rolls and one appetizer, and each one did not disappoint.  The price point isn't bad at all, considering the quality of the fish you'll be having.
author: Alison K.

description: My mistake was ordering dishes I am used too....when I was offered certain dishes, they DID NOT disappoint... The Walu was great, the Flaming Seabass was out of this world.... I found my mandatory stop, every time I am in SF
author: Stephen G.

description:
This is by far one of my favorite Sushi restaurants in San Francisco. It's super convenient for me to get to living in the Russian Hill/Nob Hill area and the fish is always fresh and delicious. I would recommend the white-out role and the rainbow role. The walu carpaccio is also one of my favorite items on the menu!

Great for date-night or dinner with friends. It's pretty tiny though so I wouldn't recommend it for large parties.
author: Katie S.

description: Quite a few of the reviews here mention the hours of operation, so we laughed when after reading they are open 5:30-10:30 they are not open when we arrive at 5:50. There was a sign on the door saying open at 6 tonight. Oh well. We didn't wait long. They seem very popular. They have a very limited wine selection, sake, green tea. That's it, so we just stuck with the water they give you. I don't know if it was just us, but we received a sample of the butter fish app. It was good. I will say once the doors were open they were nice. We ordered 4 rolls; Giant, white out, flaming sea bass, and red dragon. The giant was the best. The flaming sea bass is interesting. It's brought out wrapped in foil, sitting on a bowl filled with the flammable liquid, and they leave it sitting for 7 min. During that time our bowl just exploded. Scared the bejeezus out of me. All of the rolls were good. It's not the absolute best I've ever had, but it was good. Going back to the flaming sea bass, in the end it was slightly burned to the bottom, and basically tasted like fish with a little rice. It really had no depth of flavor. In fact I thought all of the rolls were kind of one note. It was very trendy and trying to be. They have 4 young sushi geek guys behind the counter, a very young hostess that was wearing a giant ushanka. The music ranged from old reggae to serious rap. It has a very young vibe. It's very easy to find. Right on the Powell-Hyde line. We are glad we tried it but probably won't go back.
author: Nancy P.

description: Omg omg omg! Nick said if he could work it out with his job, either start working from home or transfer to st Pete office, that he would give Florida a shot! Only TEMPORARILY as he put it. I convinced him 3-5 years unless we both decide to leave earlier. Cross your fingers that his boss gives the okay! He said he would talk to him this week so we shall see. I love you!
author: Nicole R.

description: Great all around! Interesting taste of sushi. Not your average sushi joint for sure.
author: Carrie T.

description: Delicious every time I come in.  Great use of oils, sauces, and non-traditional ingredients to increase the excitement. Flat out good fish.
author: Trevor R.

description: Definitely the best sushi in the area. Cannot get enough of it! They are always busy, which means waiting is most likely gonna happen. They aren't the biggest place either, but then again, what is in SF?! Anyways, their food is delicious. The Boombox is probably one of my favorite rolls, with its pieces of bananas! I always get their salmon & butterfish nigiri. The staff is very nice and in my more than what seems to be 1000 times eating there (my gf & I eat there almost weekly), the atmosphere remains the same. Drinks are basic, but my gf like their Hello Kitty Martini...I don't haha
author: B G.

description: Wow!  Baked Sea Bass roll was excellent as was everything else sashimi and rolls.  Service was great.  Love the Hyde Street location in Russian Hill.  Was pleasantly surprised at the reasonable prices.
author: Drew L.

description: this place is amazing. So many unique dishes.  Himalayan Trout on the rock salt - WOW. and $2 sake bombs?! yes please! and yes like everyone has said service is super friends.  Definitely my new favorite sushi place and will be coming back.
author: Lily Z.

description: A hidden gem!  Very fresh and inventive.  The beastie boys was my favorite as well as the blue fin tuna.  On average about $50 a person though, but thats the price you pay for the good stuff.
author: Nagoo N.

description: Yum!!! This was my first time tasting sushi and it was a beautiful thing! I'm a vegetarian and had the cucumber roll and avocado roll. Both were amazing! Then the waiter told me a veggie lovers secret called the "green machine". It had mango and veggies and yummy sauce. A must have! Overall great atmosphere. Small little place with a lot of character. Very loud but fun for a night out!
author: Ashlee S.

description: Best. Sushi. Best Value. Ample sized rolls, beautiful presentation, nicely crafted chopsticks to add to dining experience, and friendly, professional staff. Nice quiet outside seating for studying.
author: Alicia P.

description: Today we had a bad experience in terms of service. We were told they would call us after 45 minutes. After 1 hour I called them and they told me it will take another 20 minutes. We went there and it took another 10 minutes. The waitress told us something strange and was quite rude. The girls at the door seemed to be very disoriented and confused. Some others complaint as well. The food was good but wine overpriced
author: Chris S.

description: A friend recommended this place, but I wanted to get a sense of the wait before I showed up. I called and the hostess told me I would need to come; she couldn't tell me over the phone and promptly hung up on me. If that's how you treat me when I haven't yet decided whether to spend money at your restaurant, it's pretty simple; I'm just not interested.
author: Julianna K.

description:
I don't really know what all the buzz is about for this place... There always seems to be a line unless you get there at around 6. We tried it out and we're pretty disappointed. They make their own ginger and I think their own soy sauce, which is admirable, but both had a weird unsettling flavor. Our food was also on the "meh" side - it just didn't taste fresh. Maybe we ordered the wrong things.... With the other sushi restos in the area that don't have a wait, I don't think I'll be going back to this place... 

It does have a cool atmosphere though...
author: Maria Y.

description: Really good sushi.  Love the beastie boy, the white out and actually all of the items we tried but especially the beastie boy.  Can't go wrong with uni + little monkfish liver + quail egg. Well priced sake bombs = a good time for all.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Sue L.

description: The sushi/maki is very good here, but I don't understand why they don't have miso soup and why they dropped the eclectic vegetarian roll they had. Two other things that really stink are the wait to get a table (but that's not anyone's fault really) and the very poor service. I won't go into detail, because all of the employees are very very nice, but I'm sorry to say the service is quite awful.
author: Ryan M.

description: We tried to go to this restaurant for our friend's birthday and they turned us away because they do not take groups of 5. They wouldn't even let us split up into two groups for dinner. It was ridiculous. I didn't appreciate the rude attitude from the hostess when we asked to be split into two groups either.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Great food, great service. We will def be coming back here. The Flaming Sea Bass was awesome!!!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Elephant sushi is very fresh. We come here for the sashimi. So, so good. Love the sashimi salads. Decent saki choices. The place is small, but they are good if you call, they will let you put your name on the wait list. Staff gets overwhelmed sometimes, but they are always prompt.
author: Ev w.

description: Exceptional ambience, service, sushi, and value.  I'd put in the top 2 sushi places in SF.
author: Justin N.

description: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and we loved it. The sushi tasted really fresh and clean. The ambiance is lovely and the staff is very welcoming; it's a perfect spot for a date. I eat sushi a lot and have been to a number of sushi restaurants--Elephant Sushi is definitely in my top five.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Normally I'm not a huge fan of innovative sushi, because it always ends up in a failure because restaurants like to jam every ingredient they can think of together and ruin the taste of everything. This place however, is doing a pretty good job on their not-so-traditional sushi. However it's sort of hit and miss. Some are really, really good, but some are terrible. 'Happy Together' is a huge miss for us. The huge chunk of sweet and sore mango ruins all the taste of uni (which isn't that fresh in the first place), however the flaming sea bass and the scallop appetizer were delicious

I can't rate this place so high not only because of a couple of 'miss' dish we had, but also the quality of the fish. It's not that fresh compared to other places I've been to, plus the chef need to work on his knife skill. For sushi it's very important not to ruin the raw fish with clumsy knife!
author: Bobo V.

description: Really love this place. I have had a lot of sushi in SF that leaves me feeling "eh", but Elephant was not one of those places. They have great fish, a creative (without trying too hard) menu, and beautiful presentation. The atmosphere is cozy but stylish and the staff is super friendly. The himalayan trout is so good I actually crave it daily.
author: Kristen A.

description: Wonderful sushi !  Although the wait was ridiculous, the food was out of this world. Seriously , every dish was great and the blue fin and salmon sushi were to die for.
author: Andy V.

description:
I had a great dinner and a great night out!

I am new to sushi but I went with two experts.  They were incredibly impressed by the quality and innovative approach.  I was intrigued by all of the wonderful flavors and how good those little bits of raw fish can taste!  

The flaming sea bass was spicy and exotic.  I loved the black heirloom tomatoes and raw okra on the sashimi salad - nice touches. I'm super in love with the house pickled ginger.  And thank you for thinking about gluten-free soy sauce.  

The decor/ambience are a perfect complement to the food - stylish and unique, but comforting.  There is a secluded table for slightly larger groups and the main dining room is very welcoming. 

A great place to eat with friends!
author: Kate S.

description: the staff is really nice, slightly affected  by their meteoric success, but I can understand that. their sushi was ok. something in their rice was amiss but definitely a place to check out.
author: Augusto N.

description: Stumbled on this place one evening when the wait was too long at Zarzuela. Turns out it was their soft opening -- with a limited menu at a pay-what-you-want price. There was still enough options to get a decent selection and an idea of what the restaurant has to offer. I had the White Out roll which was delicious and a part of the flaming sea bass roll (even better). All of the fish tasted extremely fresh and the atmosphere with cozy while still feeling a bit upscale. Definitely seems like it would be a good date location. Afterwards the chef came out and greeted us with fist bumps, which definitely made the experience feel even more personal. Would definitely come back here to try out the full menu.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Loved it thoroughly. Get Sea Bass everything! This place is modern and if you stick to what's recommended you will be impressed. Giant roll was a bit too out there for us. Everything else impressed.
author: Nelson C.

description: My first dinner at this place blew my mind completely. Now on this second dinner I think a lot of the good things remain the same: The waiters are super nice, the interior is nice and the waiters care about when they serve food and the order of the servings and warn of any minor delays, etc. The "missing star" is mainly due to the food (this time) being somewhat on the too much on the greasy side for being sushi. It may just be me but seemed different than first time I was there... but I'll definitely be back anyway :)
author: Mikkel S.

description: I  really liked this place.  The service was friendly and the food was really creative and good....not your everyday japanese sushi better quality and care.  Only complaints were parking was kind of hard, some portions were  small, and they did not have that sushi  ice cream dish for dessert I just read about.  Otherwise  I really enjoyed my time here and will be back.
author: Christopher T.

description: The best Sushi I've ever had. That's it. You don't know quality until you've had sushi here, it's incredibly tender almost unrecognizable compared to the fish at almost every other sushi place. It is very small and you have to put your name on a list with a wait time being typical, luckily there is a wine bar next door you can hang out at while you wait. But it is worth the wait. I'll say again, the best sushi I've ever had which is a tall order for San Francisco alone, let alone somebody who's travelled to Japan.
author: Reed P.

description:
I love this place! Fresh, delicious food & friendly service has made me a fan.

I've been here 3 times- twice on dates and once with a 9-person party. Each time my experience was great. When I arranged to have a large party come with the hostess, she was very helpful and our table was ready on time. Everyone raved about the food... and we tried almost everything on the menu!
author: Nicole V.

description: I am in love with this little neighborhood spot. It is always consistent and fabulous. The staff is SO friendly and welcoming and the sushi is the best I have had here in SF so far. The flaming sea bass is obviously incredible. Be sure to try this. The place is very tiny so be prepared to wait... but that is ok! there is even a cute wine bar a few doors down you could pop into. You will enjoy every bite from your chopsticks!
author: A H.

description: Wow.  This place was amazing.  The menu was super creative, the wait staff was so nice and attentive, and the whole atmosphere had this warm yet hip vibe that made us feel warm and fuzzy inside.  It was the perfect dinner.  We tried all of the usual suspects based on the other Yelp reviews, and we were not disappointed.  True, you have to wait if you don't have reservations.  True, the parking situation is atrocious.  But the food and the service completely make up for both these things and if you like sushi, you have to check this place out.
author: Mrs. E.

description: The food was amazing, but I think it was the service that really put Elephant Sushi in a league of its own. The hostess was so accommodating and talked to us like we were her friends that she was doing her best to squeeze in (she gave us updates every few minutes, then managed to get us a wonderful window table). Our waiter continued this hospitality by patiently answering our menu questions and even kindly advising us that we'd ordered too much.  Despite being very busy, he took the time to talk with us (again, like we were friends) and answer our nerdy questions about the fuel behind the magical flaming seabass. The comment cards at the end are fun, and we enjoyed reading the different comments that others had left posted in the front window. I look forward to going back!
author: Californian I.

description: Absolutely incredible!  The sushi is amazing and fresh, definitely doesn't need to be hidden with a bunch of sauces and tempura.  I have never had a bad meal at this place.  Very reasonably priced and an amazing local experience.  Highly recommended!
author: D L.

description: Packed little place, but worth the wait!  The Walo (Hawaiian Escolar) was incredible and prepared with the freshest fish I've ever had.  Really creative rolls, including one with banana that was so delicious.  Staff was great, attentive and super friendly.  What a great place!
author: Leila G.

description: Amazing! Delicious, friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Hey there early if you don't have a reservation. My husband and I sat at the bar and are still dreaming of that meal as we fly back to Asheville.
author: Jessika B.

description: It's okay - not as great as the hype. Very loud inside so not that great for ambience. The spicy hamachi is good, the ya man has too much of an oniony taste. Plus, we thought they overhyped the wait list - so instead of walking around and waiting for an hour, I think if u just wait at the door u can get seated before ur 'turn' comes up.
author: Farzana G.

description: This place was great. We really enjoyed the sushi here. We had the flaming sea bass which was served in foil suspended over flaming alcohol. It was neat and showy but wasn't a show stopper flavor wise. We really LOVED the boom box. Banana + Sushi = yumminess! It was an unexpected combo that I'm so happy I tried. We were visiting from Denver so it was a great spot too find. Thought it made an awesome date night spot.
author: Heather L.

description: Elephant Sushi is my favorite sushi spot in town. Their rolls are super fresh and creative. The staff is very friendly and you can see the brothers who own the place roll sushi all night long. My favorite thing here is to get sake bombs and the flaming see bass as well as the roll that has banana in it.
author: Z K.

description: Overall, this is my favorite place to eat in SF. The sushi is very fresh and flavorful, and there are a lot of options available. There is even a cooked roll -- the flaming sea bass roll-- is actually a cooked roll that people that do not generally eat sushi will enjoy. If you are a fan of good fish, this place is definitely a must visit.
author: Mike H.

description: Place is amazing! Bit of a wait and service can be chaotic, but the food is unreal. So good.
author: Jordan K.

description: Delicious and generous portions for a reasonable price, AND $2 sake bombs- it does not get any better! The restaurant has a cozy, romantic ambiance and friendly service. I will definitely be back here!
author: Julia W.

description: Wonderful experience. After only one (1) trip around the block, there was a roomy parking space directly across the street; an indication of the experience to come. The eclectic menu's offerings were great. I had a sashimi salad and nigiri sushi. Service excellent, food was fresh and tasty and the ambiance wonderful. Can't wait to return.
author: Najiyyah K.

description: I heard it was good, and wanted to try.  But I found out they don't do take-out even if you bring your own dish, so I never did get to have any.  I find that policy inflexible and frustrating.
author: Arya C.

description: Good sushi place and very nice environment.  Everyone love their sizzling flaming sea bass, but I thought it was ok only for me.  Everything else I had was terrific!
author: T. C.

description: Worth the one hour-ish wait! Love the red and yellow roll! Flaming sea bass was good, but I prefer raw fish. We also had the hamachi with truffle oil and sake sashimi; everything was so fresh and tasty. My man got the beastie boys roll and raved about it, but it looked suspicious to me because of the yolk and sea urchin:). Overall, it was my favorite Japanese restaurant and makes me think twice about returning to my regular spots. So yummy! Not crazy expensive either; each person paid $35...we had a couple of drinks too.
author: Signe M.

description: We waited outside of Elephant Sushi before it opened so that we could get a table on a Sunday night. It was the best decision ever! When we got there, we got a free appetizer - which was the truffle hamachi. It was absolutely delicious! For the main course, we got the kobe beef and the flaming sea bass. I really enjoyed both dishes!
author: Amanda L.

description: Very fresh and delicious fish. Fatty tuna melted in my mouth! Rolls are inventive and sets them apart from other sushi joints. Our waitress had great suggestions and was very attentive. Can't wait to go back!
author: lisa a.

description: Just came here last night for dinner.  We were visiting Fisherman's Wharf in the area and started to crave sushi.  We found this on yelp and decided to WALK there to eat.  That was a mountain of a climb (we're not in the best of shape...and it was a huge incline)    ANYWAY, the food was WORTH the wait.   If you ever go here, you need to try the specials including the trout (on the salt rock) and albacore (also on the salt rock)  The sushi rice is prepared so well.  I also appreciated the homemade pickled ginger.  This place is awesome.
author: Curtis C.

description: When I crave sushi - this is what I crave.  Fresh, delicious and with great service!  My husband and I went once a week for a month straight and on our way out the 4th time, we heard "see you next week".  Good to know they remember the customers too :)
author: Lisa C.

description: We came on a Saturday night, and there was a bit of a wait, so we went to a wine bar a few doors down, and Elephant called us when our table was available.  I liked all of the food we got, and it even made me really full, which sushi rarely does. Definitely get the flaming sea bass - it's just fun. I was also a fan of the $2 sake bombs.
author: Amy K.

description: Have not eaten here but tried to order to go and they said they don't do takeout orders although Yelp has listed that they do.
author: Gwen T.

description: Best sushi in San Francisco. Hamachi truffle = amazing. Complimentary butterfish dish and all sashimi were excellent. Great for date night or small parties. Bonus...Sapporo pitchers.
author: Katie S.

description: Owner was a space cadet on the phone. Made it absolutely impossible to schedule a reservation, was rude and talking to her employees while on the phone with me, and made absolutely no sense. Told me on the phone their website was a mess so people would waste more time googeling them to go to Yelp and read their reviews. Well, here you go. Don't wast your time.
author: Amy J.

description: sushi fans, do yourself a favor. make a reservation and get here.  not your ordinary sushi spot. all the locals know it and are devout followers.
author: Jessica H.

description: Service is pretty terrible, staff is unwilling to accommodate more than 4 at a table even if you call weeks in advance. Food is amazing, but they have a lot further to go with service delivery.
author: Shosh U.

description: Great and different experience with sushi and Japanese food! Would like to take my parents or good friends here again.
author: Susan S.

description: My boyfriend and I trek to ayce sushi places, and this one is by far the best! What really makes it stand out is how huge and delicious the sushi is. Very fresh with none of the bittererness of old fish that no amount of sauce will hide. I was also very surprised by how friendly and helpful the whole staff was. At most ayce restaurants you have to track down a waiter for anything, here the food came quickly and they took our second and third orders as soon as we finished the round. But, what really pleased me was my sister dropped her chop stick and another server very nicely handed her a new one with no fuss or feeling of inconvenience! We live in Berkeley and will for sure make the trek back to have more tasty sushi!
author: Heather B.

description: No complaints. Had some great cold nigori sake. Housemade ginger that's thick cut is really good. Really delicious and creative rolls with beautiful presentation and calm and relaxing ambiance. Small location so sometimes people are lined up at door before they open for dinner hours. Dont remember exact rolls we got except for the flaming sea bass which is really good and looks cool when served on fire! The Hyde st cable car runs right outside so a cool option for way to get there as the parking is VERY difficult in this area of Russian hill. Definetly worth a visit, in my top 3 favorite sushi places in SF (and ive been to just about everyonw listed in yop 10 on yelp) and probably close to first just because of the décor/ambiance and young happy and friendly staff plus pretty and quite location. Nearby marina and north beach if you're going out for bars or entertainment after dinner. :) Fabulous place for a date too!
author: Moshe B.

description:
Elephant Sushi is a great addition to the Hyde Street neighborhood.  When Sushi Groove closed we were disappointed to see it go, but were excited to try Elephant Sushi when it opened in it's place.  

First the good....the food.  The food is exceptional.  TRY THE FLAMING SEA BASS--you will not be disappointed.  I can't say enough about this roll.  We had a few other rolls that were great as well, but the Flaming Sea Bass was the standout.  Also good, the servers and hostess were extremely friendly and welcoming.

The Bad....Service is a little slow, but I'm willing to get past that.  The hostess seemed a bit frazzled, but I'm also willing to get past that since the place is still on the new side.  The thing that really bothered me is that when I tried to make reservation for a return trip, I asked to make a reservation for 3 people but was told that the only time available was 6:30pm.  Were they completely booked you ask?  No, they only have one table that they will allow reservations for that will seat 3 or 4 people and there was an 8pm reservation (i was looking for a 9pm reservation and the table wouldn't be open by then).  Now having been there I know how many two person tables are in the restaurant and you're telling me you can't push two of those together for someone who days in advance knows they want to come to your establishment?  That just doesn't make sense to me.  The girl on the phone was really nice, but someone there should rethink their reservation policy and how they work their tables.  

Overall, I will definitely be back because not only is it close to my house but the food is just delicious.  Go, you won't be disappointed (well with the exception of the reservation policy).
author: Amanda M.

description: Honestly delicious sushi rolls. The service here is great, the atmosphere is cool, and most importantly, the food is delicious. I had the spicy hamachi roll (I think that's what its called?) and it was seriously amazing. No, it wasn't ONLY fish draped over rice (sorry sushi snobs), but yes it was a creative, palate pleasing and fresh roll. I have been dreaming about it ever since.
author: Sarah L.

description: Four and half stars, parking took away the half, but willingness of all the staffs gave back the five. Great food, fresh, good portion and tasty, will go back for more before they raise the price,
author: F C.

description: Ate there last night and was such a great experience! We let the Chef make our selection and were thoroughly impressed! Was extra great to sit at the sushi bar and learn about all the delicious dishes he was preparing! Love the story of Elephant Sushi as well ! They were playing some great music as well! So fun and highly recommended!
author: Georgina M.

description: Awesome sushi! I had the giants roll and red and yellow last night. Best sushi I've had in years. Great addition to the Russian Hill neighborhood.
author: Lili B.

description: This is my new favorite sushi spot! The rolls are delicious, unique and reasonably priced.  I love the decor, and the service is excellent.  Elephant, you've earned a return customer!
author: J M.

description: This place is amazing.  It's always a treat to find a place that you really enjoy.  The fish is super fresh; the combinations of fish, vegetables and sauces are amazing and very unique.  The sushi chefs make their own ginger and brew their own soy sauce.  And on top of all that the people who own and run the place are super fun and nice.  I highly recommend checking out Elephant Sushi.  The restaurant is also ascetically pleasing; all the décor was designed by the two sushi chefs, who happen to be brother.  It's a family business, so the front of the restaurant is managed by one of the sushi chef's wife and the staff couldn't be friendlier.  I have been meeting 2 friends once a month for 8 years to have sushi around the Bay Area.  We have crossed many bridges, since each of us lives in a different part of the bay (North Bay, East Bay and SF) and have tried many sushi restaurants, but after last night's meal, I think we'll be come regulars at Elephant Sushi. I recommend if you are coming in after 8, to make a reservation. Please note: Their website does not represent the feel of the restaurant.  It seems to be a work in progress.
author: Ellen M.
